instruction: What should a person do if the serving officer requires it after being served a summons?
output: Every person on whom a summons is so served shall, if so required by the serving officer, sign a receipt therefor on the back of the other duplicate.

instruction: What offence is punishable under section 304 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: Culpable homicide not amounting to murder

instruction: Under what circumstances can the President call for supplementary, additional or excess grants according to article 115 of the Indian constitution?
output: The President can call for supplementary, additional or excess grants if the amount authorised by any law for a particular service for the current financial year is found to be insufficient, or when a need has arisen during the current financial year for supplementary or additional expenditure upon some new service not contemplated in the annual financial statement for that year, or if any money has been spent on any service during a financial year in excess of the amount granted for that service and for that year.

instruction: What is the 32nd point in the Code of Civil Procedure at the commencement of this Constitution?
output: Shipping and navigation on inland waterways as regards mechanically propelled vessels, and the rule of the road on such waterways, and the carriage.

instruction: What is the nature of the first offense?
output: Non-cognizable, Bailable

instruction: What is the National Judicial Appointments Commission?
output: The National Judicial Appointments Commission is a commission consisting of the Chief Justice of India, two other senior Judges of the Supreme Court, the Union Minister in charge of Law and Justice, and two eminent persons nominated by a committee. The Commission is responsible for recommending persons for appointment as Chief Justice of India, Judges of the Supreme Court, Chief Justices of High Courts, recommending transfer of Chief Justices and other Judges of High Courts, and ensuring that the person recommended is of ability and integrity.

instruction: What is the main provision of Article 257 of the Indian Constitution?
output: The executive power of every State shall be so exercised as not to impede or prejudice the exercise of the executive power of the Union, and the Union has the power to give directions to a State as may appear to the Government of India to be necessary.

instruction: What does Explanation 2 state about a person forced by a gang of dacoits to commit an offence?
output: Explanation 2 states that a person who is seized by a gang of dacoits and forced, under threat of instant death, to commit an offence, such as forcing the door of a house for the dacoits to enter and plunder, is entitled to the benefit of exception under the law.

instruction: What type of directions can the Union give to any State during the operation of a Proclamation?
output: Directions to observe such canons of financial propriety as may be specified in the directions, and to the giving of such other directions as the President may deem necessary and adequate for the purpose.

instruction: What is required of a surety when a bond is breached, in terms of penalty payment and justification?
output: The surety is required to pay the penalty or show cause, within a specified date, why payment of the sum should not be enforced against them.

instruction: What was amended for the words and figures “or section 509” in clause (a) of sub-section (5A) of Section 164 of the Code in Chhattisgarh?
output: The punctuation, words and figures were amended.

instruction: What happens when the Magistrate or Court reports the action taken under sub-section (1)?
output: The Magistrate or Court shall report to the State Government the action taken under sub-section (1).

instruction: What is the term used to indicate the same answer as previously mentioned?
output: Ditto

instruction: What is the punishment if the threat is to cause death or grievous hurt?
output: Imprisonment for 7 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What is the punishment for knowingly joining or continuing in an assembly of five or more persons after it has been commanded to disperse?
output: Whoever knowingly joins or continues in any assembly of five or more persons likely to cause a disturbance of the public peace, after such assembly has been lawfully commanded to disperse, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What is the form of oath of office for a Minister for the Union?
output: “I, A. B., do swear in the name of God that I will bear true faith and allegiance to the Constitution of India as by law established, that I will uphold the sovereignty and integrity of India, that I will faithfully and conscientiously discharge my duties as a Minister for the Union and that I will do right to all manner of people in accordance with the Constitution and the law, without fear or favour, affection or ill-will.”

instruction: Who can make a complaint on behalf of a person under the age of eighteen years or of a lunatic?
output: In case the complaint is sought to be made on behalf of a person under the age of eighteen years or of a lunatic by a person who has not been appointed or declared by a competent authority to be the guardian, and the Court is satisfied that there is a guardian so appointed or declared.

instruction: What amendment was made to section 383 in the Union territories of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Lakshadweep?
output: In section 383, the following words shall be inserted at the end, 'or if, by reason of the weather, transport or other difficulties, it is not possible to forward them to the proper Appellate Court they shall be forwarded to the Administrator or an Executive Magistrate, not below the rank of a Sub-Divisional Magistrate, who shall, on receipt of such petition of appeal and copies, record thereon'

instruction: Who is capable of taking cognizance of the crime of subjecting a married woman to cruelty under law 498A?
output: Any Magistrate

instruction: What is explained in section 213?
output: When manner of committing offence must be stated.

instruction: What does the time during which any person has been prosecuting with due diligence another prosecution, whether in a Court of first instance or in a Court of appeal or revision, against the offender pertain to?
output: It is considered in computing the period of limitation.

instruction: If an Indian citizen commits a murder in Uganda, where can they be tried and convicted?
output: An Indian citizen who commits a murder in Uganda can be tried and convicted of murder in any place in India in which they may be found.

instruction: What is the West Bengal Land Reforms (Second Amendment) Act of 1986?
output: West Bengal Act 19 of 1986

instruction: Who else, apart from the Appellate Court, can make an order under this section when exercising powers of revision?
output: A Court can also make an order under this section when exercising its powers of revision.

instruction: What should the State strive to minimise?
output: The State should strive to minimise the inequalities in income, status, facilities and opportunities amongst individuals and groups of people.

instruction: What does the accused receive immediately after the pronouncement of the judgment when sentenced to imprisonment?
output: When sentenced to imprisonment, the accused is given a copy of the judgment free of cost immediately after the pronouncement of the judgment.

instruction: What is the obligation of a person making an arrest under the mentioned Code?
output: Every police officer or other person making any arrest under this Code shall forthwith give the information regarding such arrest and place where the arrested person is being held to any nominated person.

instruction: What are the specific powers of a civil court that the Commission possesses during an investigation, including any additional powers determined by the President?
output: The Commission shall have the powers to summon and enforce the attendance of any person from any part of India and examine him on oath, require the discovery and production of any document, receive evidence on affidavits, requisition any public record or copy thereof from any court or office, issue commissions for the examination of witnesses and documents, and any other matter which the President may, by rule, determine.

instruction: What is the sentence 'on 376D' substituting for?
output: Section 354, section 354A, section 354B, section 354C, section 354D, section 354E, section 376, section 376A, section 376B, section 376C, section 376D, section 376E, section 376F, section 509, section 509A or section 509B

instruction: Who decides if it is reasonably practicable to hold an inquiry in respect of dismissal, removal, or reduction in rank?
output: The decision on whether it is reasonably practicable to hold such an inquiry lies with the authority empowered to dismiss or remove such person or to reduce him in rank.

instruction: What is introduced after the grants have been made by the Assembly?
output: A Bill to provide for the appropriation out of the Consolidated Fund of the State

instruction: What is the consequence of failing to produce or deliver a required document to a Court of Justice?

instruction: Can the High Court provide copies of any judgment or order of a Criminal Court to any person?
output: Yes, the High Court may, by rules, provide for the grant of copies of any judgment or order of a Criminal Court to any person who is not affected by a judgment or order.

instruction: What does the court passing the sentence do immediately after sentencing the accused to imprisonment for life or for a term in cases other than those provided for by section 413?
output: The Court shall forthwith forward a warrant to the jail or other place in which he is.

instruction: Can the State Election Commissioner be removed from his office?
output: The State Election Commissioner can be removed from his office, but only in like manner and on the like grounds as a Judge of a High Court.

instruction: Which chapter's rules are applicable, as far as may be practicable, to the judgment of a Court of Session or Chief Judicial Magistrate in appeal?
output: The rules contained in Chapter XXVII.

instruction: What happens to the sessions divisions, districts and sub-divisions existing in a State at the commencement of this Code?
output: The sessions divisions, districts and sub-divisions existing in a State at the commencement of this Code, shall be deemed to have been formed under this section.

instruction: What declaration must a person standing surety to an accused person for his release on bail make before the Court according to 441A?
output: A person standing surety to an accused person for his release on bail must declare before the Court the number of persons to whom he has stood surety including the accused, providing all the relevant particulars.

instruction: What happens if the person identifying the arrested individual is mentally or physically disabled?
output: The identification process will take place under the supervision of a Judicial Magistrate who will take appropriate steps to ensure that such person identifies the arrested individual using methods they are comfortable with. The identification process should also be videographed.

instruction: What does section 369 dictate about the confirmation of the sentence, or any new sentence or order, passed by the High Court when the court consists of two or more judges?
output: Section 369 dictates that in every case submitted, the confirmation of the sentence, or any new sentence or order passed by the High Court, should be made, passed and signed by at least two of the Judges.

instruction: What is recorded under section 161 or section 164?
output: The statements and confessions, if any.

instruction: What is the focus of section 261?
output: Section 261 focuses on summary trial by Magistrate of the second class.

instruction: What is the court for a crime that is non-bailable?

instruction: What defines a structure as being considered part of a house according to the given explanation?
output: A structure is considered part of a house if it is an out-house or building occupied with the house and there is an immediate internal communication between them.

instruction: Who does the reference in article 227 pertain to in relation to any rules, forms or tables for subordinate courts in a union territory?
output: The reference in article 227 pertains to the President.

instruction: What is the punishment for offering a gift or restoring property in consideration of screening an offender if the offence is capital?
output: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

instruction: What is the crime called when A writes a letter and signs it with B's name without B's authority?
output: Forgery

instruction: Who has the authority to deem tribes or tribal communities as Scheduled Tribes in a State or Union territory?
output: The President

instruction: What does FORM No. 56 pertain to?
output: FORM No. 56 pertains to a warrant of imprisonment on forfeiture of bond for good behaviour.

instruction: What is excluded in computing the period of limitation when a notice of prosecution for an offence has been given?
output: The period of such notice or, as the case may be, the time required for obtaining such consent or sanction is excluded.

instruction: What is the number associated with Tamil Nadu?
Which Act does a person habitually commit, attempt to commit, or abet the commission of an offence under?
output: The Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940

instruction: What happens if the accused is not acquitted under section 232?
output: He shall be called upon to enter on his defence and adduce any evidence he may have in support thereof.

instruction: What is the bail status of the offence under section 353 in Maharashtra?
output: Non-bailable

instruction: What is the Kerala Act III of 1961?
output: The Kerala Act III of 1961 is The Jenmikaram Payment (Abolition) Act, 1960.

instruction: What is done with the plea of the accused and his examination?
output: The plea of the accused and his examination (if any) are recorded.

instruction: What is the aggregate of the consecutive sentences passed against a convicted person under this section deemed to be?
output: The aggregate of the consecutive sentences is deemed to be a single sentence.

instruction: What procedure should be followed to deal with a person who has been arrested under an executed warrant of arrest?
output: The person arrested should be dealt with in accordance with the procedure prescribed by sections 80 and 81, so far as possible.

instruction: What is FORM No. 27 used for?
output: FORM No. 27 is a Magistrate’s order prohibiting the doing of anything on land or water when a dispute has arisen concerning the right of use of the property.

instruction: What is form no. 3?
output: Bond and bail.

instruction: What was in force during the period mentioned in the Code of Criminal Procedure (Amendment) Act, 1991?

instruction: Under which article is a 'Panchayat' constituted in the context of Part IXA THE MUNICIPALITIES?
output: A 'Panchayat' is constituted under article 243B.

instruction: What is the punishment for a person guilty of public misconduct while drunk?
output: The person shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to twenty-four hours, or with fine which may extend to ten rupees, or with both.

instruction: What is the right to life and personal liberty?
output: The right to life and personal liberty means that no person shall be deprived of his life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

instruction: What is the punishment for assault or criminal force on grave provocation in terms of imprisonment duration and fine amount?
output: The punishment can be simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or a fine which may extend to two hundred rupees.

instruction: What should be the minimum time elapsed between the notice and the hearing of the application?
output: At least twenty-four hours

instruction: What is the requirement for taking cognizance of the offence done by a person employed with the affairs of a State?
output: The court needs the sanction of the State Government to take cognizance of such an offence.

instruction: What would the punishment be if someone was found guilty of bribery?
output: Imprisonment for 1 year or fine, or both, or if treating only, fine only

instruction: What is the penalty for an act that causes or tends to cause danger to human life, health or safety, or causes or tends to cause a riot or affray?
output: Imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both

instruction: What is not considered an offence when done by a Judge?
output: Nothing is an offence which is done by a Judge when acting judicially in the exercise of any power which is, or which in good faith he believes to be, given to him by law.

instruction: Who should conduct the examination under the mentioned section?
output: A female registered medical practitioner.

instruction: Can an accused person be refused bail solely based on the requirement of being identified by witnesses during investigation?
output: No, the mere fact that an accused person may be required for being identified by witnesses during investigation shall not be sufficient ground for refusing to grant bail if he is otherwise entitled to be released on bail and gives an undertaking that he shall comply with such directions as may be given by the Court.

instruction: Who should not offer or make any inducements, threats or promises as per the rules of authority?
output: No police officer or other person in authority

instruction: What is the consequence of driving or riding in a manner that endangers human life on a public way?
output: The person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

instruction: What constitutes 'Grievous hurt'?
output: Grievous hurt includes emasculation, permanent privation of sight or hearing, privation of any member or joint, destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint, permanent disfiguration of the head or face, fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth and any hurt which endangers life.

instruction: Which act is designated as Central Act 46 of 1973?
output: The Foreign Exchange Regulation Act, 1973 is designated as Central Act 46 of 1973.

instruction: What can be sent in duplicate by post or otherwise to the presiding officer of a Court?
output: A summons to an accused person, a warrant for the arrest of an accused person, a summons to any person requiring him to attend and produce a document or other thing, or a search-warrant

instruction: What does section 321 of the law state about withdrawal from prosecution?
output: Section 321 states that the Public Prosecutor or Assistant Public Prosecutor in charge of a case may, with the consent of the Court, at any time before the judgment is pronounced, withdraw from the prosecution of any person either generally or in respect of any one or more of the offences for which he is tried. If the withdrawal is made before a charge has been framed, the accused shall be discharged in respect of such offence or offences.

instruction: How long is the term of office for the elected members of the District Council?
output: Five years

instruction: What is the form No. 42?
output: Form No. 42 is the warrant of execution of a sentence of death.

instruction: Who consults with the Speaker of the Legislative Assembly and the Chairman of the Legislative Council to make rules for procedure with respect to communications between the two Houses in a State with a Legislative Council?
output: The Governor

instruction: What is the finality of judgments and orders on appeal?
output: Judgments and orders passed by an Appellate Court upon an appeal shall be final, except in the cases provided for in section 377, section 378, sub-section (4) of section 384 or Chapter XXX.

instruction: Before the commencement of the Constitution, whose role was it to exercise the powers of the President?
output: The Governor-General of the Dominion of India.

instruction: What are the consequences for negligent conduct with respect to an animal?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

instruction: When does a member vacate his office as Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the House of the People?
output: When he ceases to be a member of the House of the People, when he resigns his office, or when he is removed from his office by a resolution of the House of the People.

instruction: What is allowed to be taken from a person who has been arrested under this Code?
output: Any offensive weapons which he has about his person can be taken by the officer or other person making the arrest.

instruction: What is the definition of a criminal conspiracy?
output: A criminal conspiracy is when two or more persons agree to do, or cause to be done, either an illegal act or an act which is not illegal by illegal means. This agreement is considered a criminal conspiracy as long as some act besides the agreement is done by one or more parties to such agreement in pursuance thereof. It is immaterial whether the illegal act is the ultimate object of such agreement, or is merely incidental to that object.

instruction: Can mischief be committed by an act affecting property belonging to the person who commits the act, or to that person and others jointly?
output: Yes, mischief can be committed by an act affecting property belonging to the person who commits the act, or to that person and others jointly.

instruction: What is FORM NO. 21?
output: Magistrate’s notice and peremptory order.

instruction: What is not considered interference within the meaning of section 171C?
output: A declaration of public policy or a promise of public action or the mere exercise of a legal right without intent to interfere with an electoral right is not deemed to be interference within the meaning of section 171C.

instruction: When can no such order be made according to the text?
output: After the expiry of two years from the appointed day

instruction: What occurs when the declaration of forfeiture is set aside?
output: The issue of the newspaper, book, or other document doesn't contain any such matter as referred to in sub-section (1) of section 95.

instruction: Which sections of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860) can A and B be charged under if they voluntarily assist each other to conceal sacks at the bottom of a grain-pit?
output: They can be separately charged with, and convicted of, offences under sections 411 and 414.

instruction: What are the rights of Ministers and the Attorney-General as respects Houses according to the constitution of India?
output: Every Minister and the Attorney-General of India shall have the right to speak in, and otherwise to take part in the proceedings of, either House, any joint sitting of the Houses, and any committee of Parliament of which he may be named a member, but shall not by virtue of this article be entitled to vote.

instruction: What powers can the High Court confer on any Magistrate according to section 261?
output: The High Court may confer on any Magistrate invested with the power to carry out a summary trial.

instruction: Which Schedule applies to the administration and control of the Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in any State other than the States of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram according to Article 244? And which Schedule applies to the administration of the tribal areas in the States of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram?
output: According to Article 244, the provisions of the Fifth Schedule apply to the administration and control of the Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in any State other than the States of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram. The provisions of the Sixth Schedule apply to the administration of the tribal areas in the States of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura and Mizoram.

instruction: What is the year and reference of the Bihar Privileged Persons Homestead Tenancy Act?
output: The Bihar Privileged Persons Homestead Tenancy Act is from 1947 and is referenced as Bihar Act 4 of 1948.

instruction: What is the consequence of not performing the act or appearing and showing cause as per the order under section 188 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: If the person fails to do as the order directs, they shall be liable to the penalty prescribed in section 188 of the Indian Penal Code, and the order will be made absolute.

output: No, the text does not provide specific information on what the period of six months is necessary for.

instruction: Who is the person that a offence of voluntarily causing grievous hurt is compounded to?

output: B is guilty of murder.

instruction: Can a parent censuring a child in good faith be considered defamation?

instruction: What is the punishment for 376DB Gang rape on woman under twelve years of age?

instruction: What is the basis for the salaries and allowances of the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Assembly and the Chairman and the Deputy Chairman of the Legislative Council of a State?
output: Their salaries and allowances are the same as what were payable respectively to the Speaker and the Deputy Speaker of the Legislative Assembly and the President and the Deputy President of the Legislative Council of the corresponding Province immediately before the commencement of this Constitution.

instruction: What is the penalty for having possession of a forged document, knowing it to be forged, with intent to use it as genuine, according to section 466 of the Indian Penal Code?

instruction: What does section 133 pertain to?
output: Section 133 pertains to local nuisance.

instruction: What does a court have the discretion to do under section 348 after adjudging an offender to punishment under section 345 or forwarding him/her to a Magistrate for trial under section 346 for refusing or omitting to do anything he/she was legally required to do or for any intentional insult or interruption?
output: The Court may, in its discretion, discharge the offender or remit the punishment on his submission to the order or requisition of such Court, or on apology being made.

instruction: What does Section 421 deal with?
output: Warrant for levy of fine.

instruction: Under what circumstances can a woman be separated from her husband if she is living in adultery, refusing to live with him without any sufficient reason, or living separately by mutual consent?
output: A woman can be separated from her husband under these circumstances according to the mentioned section.

instruction: What is the reference to 'Judicial Magistrate' construed as in sub-section (i) of Section 167 of the Code according to Assam Act 3 of 1984?
output: The reference to 'Judicial Magistrate' shall be construed as reference also to executive Magistrate.

instruction: What is the term used to define the jurisdiction for harbouring an offender, if the offence be capital?

instruction: What is the punishment for committing an offence under sub-section (2) in a place of worship or in an assembly engaged in religious worship or ceremonies?

instruction: What is given full faith and credit throughout the territory of India?
output: Public acts, records and judicial proceedings of the Union and of every State are given full faith and credit throughout the territory of India.

instruction: How should a summons be served on a Government servant?
output: The Court issuing the summons shall ordinarily send it in duplicate to the head of the office in which such person is employed. The head of the office shall then cause the summons to be served in the manner provided by section 62.

instruction: How is the word 'Magistrate' replaced when it is preceded by the indefinite article 'a' in sub-section (2) of Section 167 of the Code according to Assam Act 3 of 1984?
output: The words and brackets 'Magistrate (whether Judicial or Executive)' shall be substituted.

instruction: What does section 243-O of the Constitution state?
output: It bars interference by courts in electoral matters.

instruction: Can a person who has been acquitted or convicted of an offence be tried again for a distinct offence with the consent of the State Government?

instruction: What does entry 42 cover?
output: State pensions, that is to say, pensions payable by the State or out of the Consolidated Fund of the State.

instruction: Under what condition is a member of the Legislative Assembly of a State disqualified to be appointed as a Minister?
output: A member who is disqualified for being a member of that House under paragraph 2 of the Tenth Schedule shall also be disqualified to be appointed as a Minister

instruction: When shall the accused be discharged?

instruction: Who should a police officer report to after seizing property under sub-section (1)?

instruction: For which territorial areas district was the Bodoland Territorial Council constituted?

instruction: What is 'wrongful loss'?

instruction: What is the penalty if under sentence of imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years, or upwards?

instruction: Who in India has the right to speak in, and otherwise take part in the proceedings of, either House, any joint sitting of the Houses, and any committee of Parliament of which he may be named a member, but is not entitled to vote?
output: Every Minister and the Attorney-General of India

instruction: Under what circumstances can the President suspend the operation of any provision of article 239AA?

instruction: What does section 246 pertain to if the accused is not discharged?

instruction: What are the original words that have been successively amended by Act 12 of 1891, s. 2 and Sch. I, the A.O. 1937, the A.O. 1948 and the A.O. 1950?
output: The Original words are not specified in the text.

instruction: What happens if the sanctioning authority fails to take a decision within the stipulated period of ninety days?

instruction: Who can permit a member to address the House in his mother-tongue if he cannot adequately express himself in the official languages?

instruction: What is the stipulation for a police officer to be appointed as the Assistant Public Prosecutor according to the original provision?

instruction: Is it allowed for an Indian citizen to accept a title from a foreign State?

instruction: What does 'voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter public servant from his duty' imply?

instruction: What is the punishment for a public servant who negligently allows a prisoner to escape?

instruction: What can the Magistrate do at any stage of the proceedings under this section, on the application of either party?
output: The Magistrate may issue a summons to any witness directing him to attend or to produce any document or thing.

instruction: To which court does such appeal lie?
output: Such appeal shall lie to the Court to which an appeal ordinarily lies against the order of conviction of such Court.

instruction: Which offices would disqualify someone from being eligible for Vice-President under the Government of India or the Government of any State or under any local or other authority subject to the control of any of the said Governments?
output: Any office considered an office of profit would disqualify someone from being eligible for Vice-President.

instruction: What should a police officer do instead of arresting a person under section 41?

instruction: Which section of law mentions the crime of counterfeiting currency-notes or bank-notes?

instruction: What is the punishment for someone who is found guilty of manufacturing, buying, selling or disposing any tool intended for creating counterfeit government stamps?
