instruction: Under what circumstances may the President issue a Proclamation of Emergency?
output: The President may issue a Proclamation of Emergency before the actual occurrence of war or of any such aggression or rebellion, if he/she is satisfied that there is imminent danger thereof.

instruction: How can the production of an accused person be proved?
output: The production of the accused person may be proved by his signature on the order authorising detention or by the order certified by the Magistrate as to production of the accused person through the medium of electronic video linkage.

instruction: What does section 467 define?
output: Section 467 provides definitions.

instruction: Can an Ordinance be withdrawn?
output: An Ordinance may be withdrawn at any time by the Governor.

instruction: What is the number associated with Arunachal Pradesh?
What happens when the office of Chief Justice of India is vacant?
output: When the office of Chief Justice of India is vacant or the Chief Justice is unable to perform the duties of his office, the duties of the office shall be performed by such one of the other Judges of the Court as the President may appoint for the purpose.

instruction: Who can specify exceptions or modifications to any Act of Parliament in its application to the autonomous district or an autonomous region in the State of Tripura?
output: The President can specify exceptions or modifications to any Act of Parliament in its application to the autonomous district or an autonomous region in the State of Tripura.

instruction: What can the High Court do according to the provided text?
output: The High Court can call for returns from such courts, make and issue general rules, prescribe forms for regulating the practice and proceedings of such courts, prescribe forms in which books, entries and accounts shall be kept by the officers of any such courts, and settle tables of fees to be allowed to the sheriff and all clerks and officers of such courts and to attorneys, advocates and pleaders practising therein.

instruction: What does it mean to express in good faith any opinion respecting the merits of any performance which its author has submitted to the judgment of the public, or respecting the character of the author so far as his character appears in such performance, and no further?
output: This is the sixth exception of defamation.

instruction: What is the punishment if the intentional omission to apprehend on the part of a public servant results in a punishment with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years, with or without fine.

instruction: Do the provisions of sub-sections (2) and (3) apply to a declaration made by the Court?
output: Yes, the provisions of sub-sections (2) and (3) apply to a declaration made by the Court.

instruction: Which articles have provisions in effect relating to any statement and expenditure or demand and any law to be made authorising the appropriation of moneys out of the Consolidated Fund of India to meet such expenditure or the grant in respect of such demand?
output: The provisions of articles 112, 113 and 114 have effect in this context.

instruction: What is the content of section 41A?
output: Section 41A is about the notice of appearance before a police officer.

instruction: Who can compound the offence of voluntarily causing hurt under section 323 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: The person to whom the hurt is caused.

instruction: Who is responsible for making rules for the more convenient transaction of the business of the Government of the State, and for the allocation among Ministers of the said business?
output: The Governor is responsible for making these rules.

instruction: What can happen if a charge containing more heads than one is framed against the same person and a conviction has been had on one or more of them?
output: The complainant, or the officer conducting the prosecution, may, with the consent of the Court, withdraw the remaining charge or charges, or the Court of its own accord may stay the inquiry into, or trial of, such charge or charges.

instruction: What is the duration for a law made by Parliament under clause (1) to cease to have effect after the resolution has ceased to be in force and what are the exceptions to it?
output: The law shall cease to have effect on the expiration of a period of six months after the resolution has ceased to be in force, except as respects things done or omitted to be done before the expiration of the said period.

instruction: Who may a Magistrate re-call when they decide to re-hear a case in the manner provided for the trial of warrant-cases?
output: The Magistrate may re-call any witness who may have been examined.

instruction: Who can issue a summons to any witness directing him to attend or to produce any document or other thing on the application of the prosecution or the accused?
output: The Magistrate can.

instruction: What does Article 371F state about the legislative assembly of Sikkim, the period of years in clause (1) of article 172 for the Assembly of Sikkim, and the number of seats allotted to Sikkim in the House of People?
output: Article 371F provides special provisions for the State of Sikkim including: the Legislative Assembly of the State of Sikkim shall consist of not less than thirty members; the assembly formed as a result of the elections held in Sikkim in April, 1974 with thirty-two members shall be deemed to be the Legislative Assembly of the State of Sikkim under the Constitution; the period of five years in clause (1) of article 172 shall be construed as references to a period of four years for the Assembly of Sikkim; and until other provisions are made by Parliament by law, there shall be allotted to the State of Sikkim one seat in the House of the People.

instruction: What does the Constitution of India state about the jurisdiction of the Supreme Court and other courts in disputes arising from provisions, endorsements, covenants, agreements or similar instruments entered into by any person referenced in clause (1), or from any letter issued to such person in relation to his appointment to any civil service of the Crown in India or his continuance in service under the Government of the Dominion of India or a Province thereof?
output: The Constitution of India states that neither the Supreme Court nor any other court shall have jurisdiction in any such dispute.

instruction: What is prepared and delivered to a person when they are searched under sub-section (3)?
output: A list of all things taken possession of is prepared, and a copy thereof is delivered to such person.

instruction: What is the substitute clause for clause (a) in section 209 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 for the state of Gujarat?
output: The substitute clause for clause (a) is: Commit the case, after complying with the provisions of section 207 or section 208, as the case may be, to the Court of Session and, subject to the provisions of this Code relating to bail, remand the accused to custody until such commitment has been made.

instruction: Who can transfer a Judge from one High Court to another?
output: The President, on the recommendation of the National Judicial Appointments Commission, can transfer a Judge from one High Court to any other High Court.

instruction: What does Section 9 in the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 relate to?
output: Court of Session

instruction: What does the provision of the subsections apply to?
output: any order passed by a Criminal Court under any section of this Code or of any other law, which restricts the liberty of any person or imposes any liability upon him or his property

instruction: Who advises the President on the form of accounts of the Union and of the States?
output: The Comptroller and Auditor-General of India

instruction: What can be done in an appeal from any other order?
output: Alter or reverse such order.

instruction: What is the punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night?
output: The punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and a liable fine.

instruction: Who needs to confirm any sentence of death passed by a Sessions Judge or Additional Sessions Judge?
output: The High Court needs to confirm any sentence of death passed by a Sessions Judge or Additional Sessions Judge.

instruction: What is the Tamil Nadu Act 10 of 1972?
output: The Tamil Nadu Land Reforms (Fixation of Ceiling on Land) Amendment Act, 1972

instruction: What happens when the office of the Sessions Judge is vacant?
output: When the office of the Sessions Judge is vacant, the High Court may make arrangements for the disposal of any urgent application which is, or may be, made or pending before such Court of Session by an Additional or Assistant Sessions Judge, or, if there be no Additional or Assistant Sessions Judge, by a Chief Judicial Magistrate, in the sessions division.

instruction: Before whom can affidavits to be used in Court under this Code be sworn or affirmed?
output: Affidavits can be sworn or affirmed before any Judge or Judicial or Executive Magistrate.

instruction: What can the President do with respect to the constitution and functions of a committee of the Legislative Assembly of Manipur?
output: The President may, by order made with respect to the State of Manipur, provide for the constitution and functions of a committee of the Legislative Assembly of the State consisting of members of that Assembly elected from the Hill Areas of that State.

instruction: What is the procedure when an accused is proven to be incapable of entering defence due to mental unsoundness?
output: The Magistrate or Court shall record a finding to that effect and shall examine the record of evidence produced by the prosecution and after hearing the advocate of the accused but without question

instruction: Who has the power to amend the Schedule according to PART D of the constitution?
output: Parliament has the power to amend the Schedule.

instruction: Who can the pronoun 'he' and its derivatives be used for?
output: The pronoun 'he' and its derivatives can be used for any person, whether male or female.

instruction: What is the content of Section 28?
output: Sentences which High Courts and Sessions Judges may pass

instruction: Under which section of the Indian Penal Code is 'Arms' defined as articles of any description designed or adapted as weapons for offence or defence, including firearms and sharp-edged weapons?
output: Section 153AA

instruction: What is the consequence of simple imprisonment for 6 months, or a fine of 1,000 rupees, or both?
output: It is the punishment for intentional insult or interruption to a public servant sitting in any stage of a judicial proceeding.

instruction: What can the District Magistrate prohibit within the local limits of his jurisdiction for the preservation of public peace, safety, or order?
output: Under section 144A, the District Magistrate can prohibit the carrying of arms in any procession or the organising or holding of, or taking part in, any mass drill or mass training with arms.

instruction: What is the minimum and maximum term of imprisonment and other liabilities for a person convicted for the first time for disseminating private images without consent?
output: The minimum term of imprisonment is one year and the maximum can extend up to three years. The person shall also be liable to a fine.

instruction: What can be used in the re-examination of a witness according to the text?
output: Any part of a statement used in the original examination can be used in the re-examination of such witness.

instruction: What is the consequence for causing death by rash or negligent act?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What happens to all courts of civil, criminal and revenue jurisdiction, all authorities and all officers in Sikkim after the appointed day?
output: All courts of civil, criminal and revenue jurisdiction, all authorities and all officers, judicial, executive and ministerial, throughout the territory of the State of Sikkim shall continue on and from the appointed day.

instruction: Who can judge the second offense?
output: Magistrate of the first class.

instruction: What is expected from a person on probation?
output: They are required to keep the peace and be of good behaviour.

instruction: What actions did A take with B in anticipation of insolvency, intending to defraud his creditors, in the fifth example?
output: A lodges effects with B for A's own benefit, writes a promissory note binding himself to pay B a sum for value received, and antedates the note, hoping it would be believed to have been made before A was on the brink of insolvency.

instruction: What happens when a member holding office as Speaker or Deputy Speaker ceases to be a member of the Assembly?
output: He vacates his office.

instruction: Is the information about Act 14 of 1887, s. 79 provided in the text?
output: No, the details of this act are not provided in the text.

instruction: What does section 122 cover?
output: Section 122 covers the act of Collecting arms, etc., with the intention of waging war against the Government of India.

instruction: How can the order of maintenance be enforced?
output: The order of maintenance can be enforced by any Magistrate in any place where the person against whom it is made may be, on such Magistrate being satisfied as to the identity of the parties and the non-payment of the allowance, or as the case may be, expenses, due.

instruction: Who has the right to vote in the meetings of the Panchayats?
output: The Chairperson of a Panchayat and other members of a Panchayat whether or not chosen by direct election from territorial constituencies in the Panchayat area.

instruction: Who may the Legislature of a State provide for the representation in a Municipality?
output: The Legislature of a State may provide for the representation in a Municipality of people with special knowledge or experience in Municipal administration, members of the House of the People and the Legislative Assembly of the State representing constituencies in the Municipal area, members of the Council of States and the Legislative Council of the State registered as electors within the Municipal area, and the Chairpersons of the Committees constituted under clause (5) of article 243S.

instruction: What is the jurisdiction of other Courts or Magistrates in a local area when a Special Court of Judicial Magistrate is established?
output: No other Court of Magistrate in the local area shall have jurisdiction to try any case or class of cases for the trial of which such Special Court of Judicial Magistrate has been established.

instruction: Which item of the Indian Constitution discusses the extension of the powers and jurisdiction of members of a police force belonging to any State to any area outside that State, and the extension of these powers to railway areas outside that State?
output: The 80th item of the Indian Constitution discusses this.

instruction: When was the Foreigners Act passed?
output: The Foreigners Act was passed in 1946.

instruction: Which section of the Indian Penal Code pertains to the order to pay costs in non-cognizable cases?
output: Section 359

instruction: Where does the jurisdiction and powers of each Magistrate extend to, unless otherwise defined?
output: Throughout the district

instruction: Is it possible for the President or the Governor of a State to be arrested or imprisoned during their term of office?
output: No

instruction: Who are all persons examined by the Magistrate?
output: They are examined under section 200 or section 202.

instruction: What does the Constitution state about continuing any temporary law?
output: Nothing in this article shall be construed as continuing any temporary law in force beyond the date fixed for its expiration or the date on which it would have expired if this Constitution had not come into force.

instruction: What does sub-clause (c) of the clause allow the state to do?
output: Sub-clause (c) allows the state to make any law imposing reasonable restrictions on the exercise of the right conferred by the said sub-clause, in the interests of the sovereignty and integrity of India or public order or morality.

instruction: What is the subject of rule 95?
output: Rule 95 is about the power to declare certain publications forfeited and to issue search-warrants for the same.

instruction: What is the penalty for a crime that results in imprisonment for 3 years and a fine?

output: In a country or place outside India

instruction: What is the punishment for causing death?
output: The punishment for causing death is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and the offender shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the consequence if someone is found guilty of habitually dealing in stolen property?
output: Imprisonment for years and fine.

instruction: What prevents the board of a co-operative society from being superseded or kept under suspension?
output: The board of a co-operative society cannot be superseded or kept under suspension if there is no Government shareholding, loan, financial assistance, or any form of guarantee by the Government.

instruction: What does the forgery of record of Court or of public register, etc. fall under?
output: The forgery of record of Court or of public register, etc. falls under Section 466.

instruction: Who nominates the remainder of the members?
output: The remainder of the members shall be nominated by the Governor in accordance with the provisions of clause (5).

instruction: Who has the authority, by law, to define the conditions of service for an administrator?
output: The Legislature of a State

instruction: Who, apart from any other Magistrate, whether Executive or Judicial, has the authority to require the postal or telegraph authority to search for and detain a document, parcel, or thing?
output: In addition to the Magistrates and Courts, a Commissioner of Police or District Superintendent of Police can also require the postal or telegraph authority to search for and detain a document, parcel, or thing.

instruction: What should the District Planning Committee consider when preparing the draft development plan?
output: The District Planning Committee should consider matters of common interest between the Panchayats and the Municipalities including spatial planning, sharing of water and other physical and natural resources, the integrated development of infrastructure and environmental conservation. They should also consider the extent and type of available resources, whether financial or otherwise.

instruction: Who shall the Government of the corresponding Indian State as regards all property and assets and all rights, liabilities and obligations succeed?
output: The Government of each State specified in Part B of the First Schedule is the successor of the Government of the corresponding Indian State as regards all property and assets and all rights, liabilities and obligations.

instruction: What is the punishment mentioned in the seventh instance?
output: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

instruction: What is the subject of Section 39?
output: Public to give information of certain offences

instruction: During the period of investigation, inquiry, or trial, how long can a person be detained for a specific offence under that law?
output: A person can be detained for a period extending up to one-half of the maximum period of imprisonment specified for that offence under that law.

instruction: What is the rule regarding taxation of the property of the Union in India?
output: The property of the Union is exempt from all taxes imposed by a State or by any authority within a State, unless Parliament provides otherwise by law.

instruction: What is the numerical value associated with the number of authorities before whom affidavits may be sworn?
What provisions does The Jammu and Kashmir Reorganization (Adaptation of Central Laws) Order, 2020 make?
output: It makes provisions for the Jammu and Kashmir region

instruction: What could be the possible punishment for a crime that could extend up to two years of imprisonment, or with fine, or with both?
output: Personation of a juror or assessor

instruction: What should the Court of Session or Magistrate of the first class do if an appeal or an application for revision has been preferred or filed against the judgment or order?
output: They should stay further proceedings of the trial until the disposal of the appeal or the application for revision

instruction: Who may be called upon to admit or deny the genuineness of each document in court situations?
output: The prosecution or the accused, or the pleader for the prosecution or the accused

instruction: What action may the High Court take, pending the disposal of the application, if it deems it necessary in the interest of Justice for a case transfer application?
output: The High Court may order that the proceedings in the Subordinate Court shall be stayed, on such terms as the High Court may think fit to impose.

instruction: What is the consequence of making a false statement in a declaration which is legally receivable as evidence?
output: The person shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave false evidence.

instruction: Who is empowered to place or keep any person in confinement?
output: Every person who holds any office by virtue of which he is empowered to place or keep any person in confinement.

instruction: What is the penalty for a person who fraudulently or dishonestly diminishes the weight or alters the composition of an Indian coin?
output: The penalty is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and the person shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the punishment under section 294A for running a lottery office?
output: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

instruction: Who does every Public Prosecutor, Additional Public Prosecutor and Special Public Prosecutor appointed by the State Government report to?
output: They are subordinate to the Director of Prosecution.

instruction: What is entry 45 about?
output: Land revenue, including the assessment and collection of revenue, the maintenance of land records, survey.

instruction: What provisions can the Legislature of a State make by law with respect to the elections?
output: The Legislature of a State may from time to time by law make provision with respect to all matters relating to, or in connection with, the elections including the preparation of electoral rolls and all other matters necessary for securing the due constitution of such House or Houses.

instruction: What are the conditions under which an abettor is held liable when a different act is committed than the one abetted?
output: The abettor is held liable for the different act done if it was a probable consequence of the abetment, and was committed under the influence of the instigation, or with the aid or in pursuance of the conspiracy which constituted the abetment. In such cases, the abettor is liable in the same manner and to the same extent as if he had directly abetted it.

instruction: What is the maximum duration of imprisonment and additional liabilities for committing an offence under sub-section (2) in a place of worship or in an assembly engaged in religious worship or ceremonies?
output: The maximum duration of imprisonment is five years and the offender shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the method to describe an offence in the charge when the law that created the offence gives it a specific name?
output: The offence may be described in the charge by that specific name only.

instruction: What is FORM NO. 28?
output: Bond and bail-bond on a preliminary inquiry before a Police Officer.

instruction: What substitution is made for the word 'Magistrate' in sub-section (2) of Section 167 of the Code according to Assam Act 3 of 1984?
output: The words 'Judicial Magistrate or the Executive Magistrate, as the case may be,' shall be substituted for the word 'Magistrate' at the first two places where that word is preceded by the definite article.

instruction: What happens when the period of limitation expires on a day when the Court is closed?
output: The Court may take cognizance on the day on which the Court reopens.

instruction: Which section aims to prevent injury to public property?
output: Section 152 aims to prevent injury to public property.

instruction: What was substituted by s. 2 and the First Sch., ibid.,?
output: It was substituted for “or Naval”.

instruction: What is the punishment if such disobedience causes or tends to cause danger to human life, health or safety, or causes or tends to cause a riot or affray?
output: Imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both

instruction: What does the code 204 refer to in terms of handling documents to prevent their production as evidence?
output: It refers to the act of secreting or destroying any document to prevent its production as evidence.

instruction: What is the full title of the Act mentioned in the text?
output: The Indian Penal Code

instruction: What can the regulations for non-tribal money-lending and trading potentially include?
output: The regulations may include that only a license holder can carry on the business, a maximum rate of interest that can be charged or recovered by a money-lender, and provisions for the maintenance and inspection of accounts by money-lenders.

instruction: What does the law say about a person who obstructs the lawful apprehension of another person or attempts to rescue them from custody?
output: The person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What action does the Magistrate take if the person entitled to the property cannot be identified?
output: The Magistrate may detain the property.

instruction: When can a case be transferred to the High Court?
output: A case can be transferred to the High Court if it is satisfied that a case pending in a court subordinate to it involves a substantial question of law as to the interpretation of this Constitution the determination of which is necessary for the disposal of the case.

instruction: What special provisions does the Indian Constitution allow the State to make for women, children, socially and educationally backward classes of citizens, and the Scheduled Castes and Tribes?
output: The Constitution allows the State to make special provisions for these groups, which can relate to their advancement and their admission to educational institutions, including private ones.

instruction: If abetment of an offence is considered an offence, does this apply to the abetment of such an abetment as well?
output: Yes, the abetment of an abetment is also an offence.

instruction: What can the House do if a member has been absent without permission for sixty days?
output: The House may declare his seat vacant.

instruction: Which region is associated with the number 3?
output: Uttarakhand

instruction: What should be done within six months of the close of the financial year for every co-operative society?
output: The accounts of every co-operative society should be audited.

instruction: What is mentioned in act 94?
output: Act 94 mentions an act to which a person is compelled by threats.

instruction: What is meant by 'Using evidence known to be false'?
output: This implies the act of knowingly using false or incorrect evidence in a legal proceeding.

instruction: What does the State or the District Legal Services Authority do upon receiving an application for compensation?
output: They conduct an enquiry and award adequate compensation, completing the enquiry within two months.

instruction: What is the effect of the provisions of a certain article according to the Constitution of India?
output: The Constitution of India states that the provisions of this article shall have effect notwithstanding anything in article 314 as originally enacted or in any other provision of this Constitution.

instruction: What is the Gujarat Tenancy Laws (Amendment) Act, 1976?
output: It is an act passed in Gujarat, known as Gujarat Act 37 of 1976.

instruction: What is referred to in section 292 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: Section 292 of the Indian Penal Code refers to obscene objects.

instruction: Which section of law is associated with the offence of public nuisance?
output: Section 268

instruction: What is the punishment for being a member of an unlawful assembly?
output: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine, or both.

instruction: What is an example of cheating by deceiving someone into lending money?
output: An example is when A intentionally deceives Z into a belief that A means to repay any money that Z may lend to him and thereby dishonestly induces Z to lend him money, A not intending to repay it.

instruction: When can an appeal presented under section 382 be dismissed?
output: An appeal presented under section 382 can be dismissed unless the appellant or his pleader has had a reasonable opportunity of being heard in support of the same.

instruction: What is the duration of imprisonment for a crime that also includes a fine penalty?
output: Imprisonment of 1 year which may extend to 5 years

instruction: What is covered in Chapter XII?
output: Chapter XII covers information to the police and their powers to investigate.

instruction: What is the territory of The Andaman and Nicobar Islands according to the constitution?
output: The territory which immediately before the commencement of this Constitution was comprised in the Chief Commissioner’s Province of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.

instruction: What is the topic of section 466?
output: Section 466 discusses when a defect or error does not make attachment unlawful.

instruction: What does a statement intend to cause if it is conducing to public mischief?
output: A statement conducing to public mischief intends to cause or is likely to cause any officer, soldier, sailor or airman in the Army, Navy or Air Force of India to mutiny or fail in his duty, or intends to cause fear or alarm to the public, or intends to incite any class or community of persons to commit any offence against any other class or community.

instruction: Who is responsible for appointing a Public Prosecutor in every district?
output: The State Government

instruction: Who can request for the medical examination of an arrested person?
output: A police officer not below the rank of sub-inspector can request for the medical examination of an arrested person.

instruction: What should happen within twenty-four hours of a person's death, according to sub-section (1A)?
output: The Judicial Magistrate or the Metropolitan Magistrate or Executive Magistrate or police officer holding an inquiry or investigation should forward the body with a view to its being examined to the nearest Civil Surgeon or other qualified medical person appointed in this behalf by the State Government.

instruction: What is excluded in the computation of the period of limitation?
output: The period of notice or the time required for obtaining the consent or sanction of the Government or any other authority is excluded. Also, the time during which the offender has been absent from India or from any territory outside India under the administration is excluded.

instruction: Under which section of the Indian Penal Code is Dacoity punishable?
output: Section 395

instruction: How should a person arrested be dealt with if a warrant of arrest has been executed?
output: The person arrested shall, so far as possible, be dealt with in accordance with the procedure prescribed by sections 80 and 81.

instruction: Who may a private person arrest if they commit a non-bailable and cognizable offence or if they are a proclaimed offender in his presence?
output: According to section 43, a private person may arrest any such person.

instruction: What entities are included in 'the State' according to Indian law?
output: 'The State' includes the Government and Parliament of India and the Government and the Legislature of each of the States and all local or other authorities within the territory of India or under the control of the Government of India.

instruction: Is a recommendation required for the moving of an amendment making provision for the reduction or abolition of any tax?
output: No, a recommendation is not required for the moving of an amendment making provision for the reduction or abolition of any tax.

instruction: What does section 249 detail about?
output: The absence of complainant

instruction: What is the Bihar Privileged Persons Homestead Tenancy Act?
output: It is an act from 1947, referenced as Bihar Act 4 of 1948.

instruction: What can the Supreme Court do to enforce its decree or order throughout the territory of India in any cause or matter pending before it?
output: The Supreme Court may pass such decree or make such order as is necessary for doing complete justice.

instruction: What is the offence and punishment for a police officer who tortures someone to make them confess or disclose the location of stolen property?
output: The police officer is guilty of an offence and the punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and also liable to fine.

instruction: Who has the right to make a complaint in respect of the alleged offence?
output: The person against whom the offence is alleged to have been committed has the right to make a complaint in respect of that offence before a Magistrate.

instruction: What is the duty of the Union according to Article 355 of the Indian Constitution?
output: It is the duty of the Union to protect every State against external aggression and internal disturbance and to ensure that the Government of every State is carried on in accordance with the provisions of this Constitution.

instruction: What is the punishment for committing an affray?
output: The punishment for committing an affray is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to one hundred rupees, or with both.

instruction: To what is the person released on bail bound according to the bond?
output: The person released on bail is bound to appear when called upon at the High Court, Court of Session or other Court to answer the charge.

instruction: What qualifications should the members nominated by the Governor have?
output: The members to be nominated by the Governor shall consist of persons having special knowledge or practical experience in respect of such matters as the following: Literature, science, art, co-operative movement and social service.

instruction: What is the procedure the House of the People must follow to make any grant in advance in respect of the estimated expenditure for a part of any financial year?
output: The House of the People must complete the procedure prescribed in article 113 for the voting of such grant and the passing of the law in accordance with the provisions of article 114.

instruction: In India, when is a state prisoner or prisoner of war on parole said to have escaped from lawful custody?
output: A State prisoner or prisoner of war, who is permitted to be at large on his parole within certain limits in India, is said to escape from lawful custody if he goes beyond the limits within which he is allowed to be at large.

instruction: What is the procedure in case of an accused being a lunatic?
output: 328. Procedure in case of accused being lunatic.

instruction: Who has the authority to include or exclude from the Central List of socially and educationally backward classes?
output: Parliament

instruction: What is the term for the legal requirement under law 63 for corporate bodies and societies?
output: Service of summons

instruction: Which section was inserted into the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, for its application in Tripura?
output: Section 197(IA)

instruction: What is the punishment for wrongful confinement for ten or more days?
output: The punishment for wrongful confinement for ten days or more is imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the purpose of the High Court or Sessions Judge examining the record of any proceeding before an inferior Criminal Court?
output: To satisfy itself/himself; to the correctness, legality or propriety of any finding, sentence or order, recorded or passed, and as to the regularity of any proceedings of such inferior Court

instruction: According to section 269, what are the duties of the prison officer after a court order has been issued for a detained individual's attendance?
output: The officer in charge of the prison shall cause the person named in the order to be taken to the Court in which his attendance is required, so as to be present there at the time mentioned in the order, and shall cause him to be kept in custody in or near the Court until he has been examined or until the Court authorises him to be taken back to the prison in which he was confined or detained.

instruction: What happens to the fractions after dividing the total number of votes assigned to the members of the Legislative Assemblies of the States by the total number of the elected members of both Houses of Parliament?
output: Fractions exceeding one-half are counted as one and other fractions are disregarded.

instruction: Who does Section 166B provide punishment for?
output: Section 166B provides punishment for anyone in charge of a hospital, whether public or private, who does not treat a victim.

instruction: What can these rules or orders relate to?
output: The distribution of business among the Executive Magistrates subordinate to him and the allocation of business to an Additional District Magistrate

instruction: What does the Central Government do when it receives a letter of request from a Court or an authority in a contracting State?
output: The Central Government may forward such letter of request to the Court, for execution in accordance with the provisions of sections 105D to 105J (both inclusive) or, as the case may be, any other law for the time being in force.

instruction: Who can make provisions for the offences relating to the co-operative societies and penalties for such offences?
output: The Legislature of a State.

instruction: What is the potential penalty for a crime that results in rigorous imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both?
output: The crime could be sexual harassment involving physical contact, demand for sexual favours, or showing pornography against a woman's will.

instruction: What is the executive power of the Union and each State in relation to trade according to Article 298 of the Indian Constitution?
output: According to Article 298, the executive power of the Union and of each State extends to carrying on any trade or business and to the acquisition, holding and disposal of property and the making of contracts for any purpose. However, the executive power of the Union is subject to legislation by the State in matters that Parliament cannot make laws about. Similarly, the executive power of each State is subject to legislation by Parliament in matters that the State Legislature cannot make laws about.

instruction: What happens to the interim order when the stipulated period, or the said next day expires, and the application for its vacation hasn't been disposed of?
output: The interim order shall stand vacated.

instruction: What is the potential punishment for attempting to commit culpable homicide?
output: The potential punishment for attempting to commit culpable homicide is imprisonment.

instruction: What is the punishment for someone who commits house-trespass with the intention to commit an offence punishable with death?
output: The punishment for such an act is imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years, and the person shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: Who can regulate the business of money-lender to members of the Scheduled Tribes?
output: The Governor

instruction: What does the Code say about a child under seven years of age committing offences and how is it generally interpreted?
output: The sections of this Code that contain definitions of offences do not express that a child under seven years of age cannot commit such offences, but the definitions are understood subject to the general exception which provides that nothing shall be an offence which is done by a child under seven years of age.

instruction: What significant event in the Constitution took place on the twenty-sixth day of January, 1950?
output: The remaining provisions of the Constitution came into force.

instruction: What can the Court do if a witness departs from the place where they have to attend before the time at which it is lawful for them to depart?
output: If a witness departs from the place they are required to attend before the lawful time to depart, the Court can take cognizance of the offence.

instruction: Which form is used for the order of attachment to compel the attendance of a witness?
output: FORM NO. 6

instruction: Who appoints the District Magistrate?
output: The State Government

instruction: What expenses can be incurred in respect of process-fees, witnesses and pleader's fees?
output: These can be included in the costs.

instruction: Who is responsible for the damages caused by their cattle or animal?
output: The owner of the cattle or animal.

instruction: What can the Magistrate do on the application of the prosecution?
output: The Magistrate may issue a summons to any of its witnesses directing him to attend or to produce any document or other thing.

instruction: Which act refers to the territories in Part II of the First Schedule?
output: The Constitution (One Hundredth Amendment) Act, 2015.

instruction: Is it allowed for a warrant to be executed by the arrest or detention in prison of the offender?
output: No, such warrant shall not be executed by the arrest or detention in prison of the offender.

instruction: What is the context where the term 'Saving' refers to 429?
output: It's not specified in the provided information.

instruction: Which article mentions that a practising pleader cannot sit as a Magistrate in certain Courts?
output: Article 480

instruction: What does the Magistrate do if the police report does not relate to any accused in the complaint case?
output: If the police report does not relate to any accused in the complaint case, the Magistrate shall proceed with the inquiry or trial, which was stayed by him, in accordance with the provisions of this Code.

instruction: What is covered under rule 97?
output: Rule 97 is about the search for persons wrongfully confined.

instruction: What is the consequence mentioned in the third instance if someone commits a crime?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What does section 248 pertain to?
output: Section 248 is about altering appearance of coin with intent that it shall pass as coin of different description.

instruction: Which court handles cases of import or export of counterfeit coin, knowing the same to be counterfeit?
output: Magistrate of the first class.

instruction: What information is provided in the text regarding the process for extradition according to the constitution?
output: Not specified in the provided text.

instruction: Which type of crimes does a Magistrate of the first class try?
output: Offences under the sections 354, 354A, 354B, 354C, 354D, 354E, 376B, 376C, 376F, 509, 509A or 509B

instruction: When does the Governor give his address at the commencement of the first session of each year and after each general election to the Legislative Assembly?
output: The Governor gives a special address to the Legislative Assembly at these times.

instruction: What is the maximum duration of imprisonment for someone convicted of wrongful confinement in secret, in addition to other liabilities?
output: The maximum duration of imprisonment for someone convicted of wrongful confinement in secret can extend to two years, in addition to other liabilities.

instruction: Which point of the Code of Civil Procedure at the commencement of this Constitution covers the registration of births and deaths in vital statistics?
output: The 30th point.

instruction: What does it mean to fraudulently accept, receive or claim any property or any interest therein, knowing that one has no right or rightful claim to such property or interest, with the intention of preventing that property or interest therein from being taken as a forfeiture or in satisfaction of a fine?
output: It means to fraudulently claim property to prevent its seizure as forfeited or in execution.

instruction: In which state does the Bodoland Territorial Council have these additional powers?
output: The Bodoland Territorial Council has these additional powers in the state of Assam.

instruction: What is Form No. 44A about?
output: Form No. 44A is a bond for appearance of offender released pending realisation of fine.

instruction: What can the Court do in terms of costs when dealing with applications under section 125?
output: The Court has power to make such order as to costs as may be just.

instruction: What happens if the accused refuses to plead, does not plead, or claims to be tried or is not convicted under section 229?
output: If the accused refuses to plead, or does not plead, or claims to be tried or is not convicted under section 229, the Judge shall fix a date for the examination of witnesses, and may, on the application of the prosecution, issue any process for compelling the attendance of any witness or the production of any document or other thing.

instruction: What is the form called that is used as a Notice to surety on breach of a bond?
output: FORM NO. 48

instruction: What can an officer in charge of a police station do without a warrant according to section 153?
output: The officer can enter any place within the limits of such station for the purpose of inspecting or searching for any weights or measures or instruments for weighing, used or kept therein, whenever he has reason to believe that there are in such place any weights, measures or instruments for weighing which are false.

instruction: What is the penalty for voluntarily corrupting or fouling the water of any public spring or reservoir?
output: The penalty is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

instruction: What happens if an abettor is present when offence is committed?
output: Same as for offence committed.

instruction: Who should a Vice-President address his resignation letter to, if he decides to resign?
output: If a Vice-President decides to resign, he should address his resignation letter to the President.

instruction: Who does the Medical Board consist of?
output: The Medical Board consists of the head of psychiatry unit in the nearest government hospital and a faculty member in psychiatry in the nearest medical college.

instruction: What does article 276 relate to?
output: Taxes on professions, trades, callings and employments

instruction: What can the Magistrate do if the accused pleads guilty in his absence, according to section 253(2)?
output: The Magistrate may, in his discretion, convict the accused in his absence, on his plea of guilty and sentence him to pay the fine specified in the summons, and the amount transmitted by the accused shall be adjusted towards that fine.

instruction: What will a court, judge, or magistrate in a contracting state do if they have a summons or warrant?
output: They shall cause the same to be served or executed as if it were a summons or warrant received by it from another Court in the said territories for service or execution within its local jurisdiction.

instruction: Who takes action upon the report from the Lieutenant in case of failure of constitutional machinery?
output: The President

instruction: Who is a subordinate police officer required to report the result of any investigation made under a certain chapter to?
output: The officer in charge of the police station

instruction: What is required to take cognizance of any offence according to sub-section (2)?
output: One may take cognizance of any offence upon receiving a complaint of facts which constitute such offence, upon a police report of such facts, or upon information received from any person other than a police officer, or upon his own knowledge, that such offence has been committed.

instruction: Which section states that the sentence may be wholly or partly rigorous or simple in certain cases of imprisonment?
output: Section 60 states that.

instruction: How is abduction defined?
output: Forcefully compelling or deceitfully inducing any person to go from any place

instruction: What is needed to satisfy any judgment, decree or award of any court or arbitral tribunal?
output: The sums are required.

instruction: What is the potential consequence if one instigates a sect consisting of more than ten members to attack another sect?
output: The potential consequence can be imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What happens if the Court finds that the application has been filed involuntarily by the accused or he has previously been convicted for the same offence?
output: The Court shall proceed further in accordance with the provisions of this Code from the stage such application has been filed under sub-section (1).

instruction: What does regulation of mines and mineral development subject to the provisions of List I with respect to regulation and development under the control of the Union mean?
output: This refers to the control and regulation of mining activities and the development of mineral resources, as per the regulations specified in List I and under the control of the Union.

instruction: What does an incorporated company or other body corporate and a society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (21 of 1860) refer to in this context?
output: In this context, an incorporated company or other body corporate and a society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 (21 of 1860) refer to a 'corporation'.

instruction: What does Section 164 provide information on?
output: Section 164 provides information on the recording of confessions and statements.

instruction: What could potentially occur to a person who is unable to execute a bond?
output: They may be detained in custody until such bond is executed or, in default of execution, until the inquiry is concluded.

instruction: What happens to the Order of the Administrative Tribunal after its confirmation by the State Government or after three months have passed since its creation?
output: The Order of the Administrative Tribunal finally disposing of any case becomes effective.

instruction: How many members are there in the regional council for the Tuensang district?
output: There are thirty-five members in the regional council for the Tuensang district.

instruction: Under what conditions can a report of identification under the hand of an Executive Magistrate be used as evidence?
output: A report of identification under the hand of an Executive Magistrate can be used as evidence in any inquiry, trial or other proceeding under this Code, although such Magistrate is not called as a witness.

instruction: What powers does a Regional Council or District Council have according to paragraph 4?
output: They can make rules regulating the constitution of village councils and courts, the procedure to be followed by village councils or courts, the enforcement of decisions and orders of such councils and courts, and all other ancillary matters for the carrying out of the provisions

instruction: What is the punishment for voluntarily causing grievous hurt to deter a public servant from his duty?
output: Imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

instruction: Do the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908, and the Code of Criminal Procedure, 18981, apply to the trial of any suits, cases or offences in an autonomous district or in any autonomous region?
output: Except as expressly provided in this paragraph, the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908, and the Code of Criminal Procedure, 18981, shall not apply to the trial of any suits, cases or offences in an autonomous district or in any autonomous region.

instruction: What does point 71 of the Constitution of India pertain to?
output: Union pensions, that is to say, pensions payable by the Government of India or out of the Consolidated Fund of India.

instruction: What can the President do during the enforcement of the rights conferred by Part III during emergencies?
output: During the enforcement of the rights conferred by Part III during emergencies, the President may declare that the right to move any court for the enforcement of such of the rights as may be mentioned in the order and all proceedings pending in any court for the enforcement of the rights so mentioned shall remain suspended for the period during which the Proclamation is in force or for such shorter period as may be specified in the order.

instruction: Is it possible to order the withdrawal of a complaint once the trial in the Court of first instance has concluded?
output: No

instruction: What is the legal consequence of an insult intended to provoke breach of peace?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What happens if the person against whom an order for payment of maintenance is proposed, wilfully avoids service or neglects to attend the court?
output: The Magistrate may proceed to hear and determine the case ex parte and any order so made may be set aside for good cause shown on an application made within three months from the date thereof subject to such terms including terms as to payment of costs to the opposite party as the Magistrate may think just and proper.

instruction: What is the maximum fine for an offence committed in the presence of the Court according to section 345 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: The maximum fine is two hundred rupees.

instruction: To whom does the High Court send its judgment or order if the lower court is that of an Executive Magistrate?
output: The High Court’s judgment or order shall be sent through the District Magistrate.

instruction: What powers can the High Court give to a Special Judicial Magistrate?
output: The High Court may empower a Special Judicial Magistrate to exercise the powers of a Metropolitan Magistrate in relation to any metropolitan area outside his local jurisdiction.

instruction: What determines the location of sittings for the Court of Special Judicial Magistrate?
output: It can hold its sitting at any place within the local area for which it is established.

instruction: What is the penalty for a crime that may extend to one year of simple imprisonment or with fine, or both?
output: The punishment for attempting to commit suicide.

instruction: What is the maximum term of imprisonment and additional penalties for someone who aids an assault by an officer, soldier, sailor, or airman, in the Army, Navy, or Air Force of the Government of India, on a superior officer during the execution of his office?
output: The maximum term of imprisonment is three years, and the person may also be liable to a fine.

instruction: Who can judge the offence of a person legally bound to provide information?
output: Any Magistrate.

instruction: Is the punishment for someone who knowingly exploits a trafficked person for sexual purposes explicitly stated in the provided text?
output: No, the punishment is not explicitly stated in the provided text.

instruction: What additional evidence is required in such cases?
output: Evidence as to the identity of the accused person with the person so convicted or acquitted.

instruction: What constitutes the offence of a man having sexual intercourse with his own wife who is under eighteen years old, according to the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860) if more than one year has elapsed from the date of the commission of the offence?
output: This constitutes the offence under section 376 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860).

instruction: What is the punishment for forgery?
output: The punishment for forgery is detailed in section 465.

instruction: What is the definition of 'Arms' as per the explanation under section 153AA of the Indian Penal Code?
output: 'Arms' means articles of any description designed or adapted as weapons for offence or defence and includes fire arms, sharp edged weapons.

instruction: Under what conditions and who has the authority to direct the confinement location of an individual liable to be imprisoned under the Code?
output: Except when otherwise provided by any law for the time being in force, the State Government has the power to direct in what place any person liable to be imprisoned or committed to custody under the Code shall be confined.

instruction: Under what circumstances can the Court provide a copy of judgement or order free of cost?
output: The Court can provide a copy of judgement or order free of cost if it thinks fit for some special reason.

instruction: What is the penalty for a public servant who intentionally frames an incorrect record or writing to save a person from punishment or property from forfeiture?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What matters can the law specify in relation to the autonomous State?
output: The matters enumerated in the State List or the Concurrent List with respect to which the Legislature of the autonomous State shall have power to make laws, the matters with respect to which the executive power of the autonomous State shall extend, any tax levied by the State of Assam that should be assigned to the autonomous State, any reference to a State in the constitution should include the autonomous State, and make any necessary supplemental, incidental and consequential provisions.

instruction: What is the reference of the Gujarat Act 31 of 2017, s. 6?
output: The reference is related to the provision of 'Personal attendance of the accused' which includes his attendance through the medium of Electronic Video Linkage as provided in section 273.

instruction: What should the authorisation referred to in clause (b) of the proviso to sub-section (1) contain?
output: The authorisation should be in writing, signed or otherwise attested by the husband, contain a statement that he has been informed of the allegations upon which the complaint is to be founded, be countersigned by his Commanding Officer, and be accompanied by a certificate signed by that Officer to the effect that leave of absence for the purpose of making a complaint in person cannot for the time being be granted to the husband.

instruction: Who can inquire into or try an offence of cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property if the property was delivered by the person deceived or was received by the accused person within their local jurisdiction?
output: A Court within whose local jurisdiction the property was delivered by the person deceived or was received by the accused person can inquire into or try the offence.

instruction: What is meant by 'Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage'?
output: It refers to a situation where a marriage ceremony is deceitfully conducted without a legal marriage taking place.

instruction: What are the possible appointments for the Chairman of a State Public Service Commission after ceasing to hold office?
output: The Chairman of a State Public Service Commission shall be eligible for appointment as the Chairman or any other member of the Union Public Service Commission or as the Chairman of any other State Public Service Commission, but not for any other employment either under the Government of India or under the Government of a State.

instruction: Who is capable of judging a theft case involving a clerk or servant?
output: Any Magistrate

instruction: What should happen to a person arrested under a warrant and who should take him before a Magistrate having jurisdiction in the case?
output: He shall be made over with the warrant to the nearest police officer, who shall cause him to be taken before a Magistrate having jurisdiction in the case.

instruction: Under which section of the Code can any Court impound any document or thing produced before it, if it thinks fit?
output: Section 104

instruction: What happens when the State Government's order is in force?
output: So long as the order remains in force, no order made under section 267, whether before or after the order of the State Government, shall have effect in respect of such person or class of persons.

instruction: Which state is associated with the number 1?
output: Mizoram

instruction: What is the District Magistrate/Collector authorized to do according to Form No. 8?
output: The District Magistrate/Collector is authorised to cause the said land to be attached, in the manner specified in clause (a), or clause (c), or both, of sub-section (4) of section 83, and to be held under attachment pending the further order of this Court, and to certify without delay what he may have done in pursuance of this order.

instruction: Is every expression from any part of the Code used in all parts of the Code, conforming with the given explanation?
output: Yes, every expression explained in any part of this Code is used in every part of the Code in conformity with the explanation.

instruction: What does the term 'population' in this article refer to as ascertained from the last preceding census of which the relevant figures have been published?
output: In this article, the term 'population' refers to the population as ascertained at the last preceding census of which the relevant figures have been published.

instruction: What does article 23 of 'THE CONSTITUTION OF INDIA' state?
output: Article 23 states that traffic in human beings and begar and other similar forms of forced labour are prohibited and any contravention of this provision shall be an offence punishable in accordance with law.

instruction: Who can authorise the detention of an accused person beyond fifteen days?
output: The Magistrate

instruction: What is the term used to refer to the exact same answer as a previously given one?
output: Ditto.

instruction: What can the appropriate Government do in cases where the sentence of death has been passed?
output: In cases where the sentence of death has been passed, the appropriate Government may, without the consent of the offender, commute the punishment for any other punishment provided by this Code.

instruction: What may the fine extend to for not keeping accounts in connection with an election?
output: The fine may extend to five hundred rupees.

instruction: What is the third provision of the exception?
output: The exception shall not extend to the voluntary causing of grievous hurt, or to the attempting to cause grievous hurt, unless it be for the purpose of preventing death or grievous hurt, or the curing of any grievous disease or infirmity.

instruction: How does A commit forgery with a cheque according to the given illustration?
output: A commits forgery by picking up a cheque on a banker signed by B, payable to bearer, but without any sum having been inserted in the cheque. A then fraudulently fills up the cheque by inserting the sum of ten thousand rupees.

instruction: Who needs to give written consent for the initiation of proceedings in the case of a criminal conspiracy?
output: The State Government or the District Magistrate

instruction: Can the powers and duties of a Judge or Magistrate be exercised or performed by his successor-in-office?
output: Yes, subject to the other provisions of this Code.

instruction: What is the definition of robbery according to this text?
output: The text does not provide a specific definition of robbery.

instruction: Which sections are not affected by the rule stated in sub-section (1)?
output: The operation of the provisions of sections 219, 220, 221, and 223 are not affected by the rule stated in sub-section (1).

instruction: Which act is referred to as The Tamil Nadu Land Reforms (Fixation of Ceiling on Land) Amendment Act, 1972?
output: The Tamil Nadu Act 10 of 1972

instruction: What should the Magistrate do when it appears from a report that the accused has been released on his bond?
output: The Magistrate shall make such order for the discharge of such bond or otherwise as he thinks fit.

instruction: What rank must a police officer be to request the medical examination of an arrested person?
output: A police officer must be not below the rank of sub-inspector to request the medical examination of an arrested person.

instruction: Who conducts the prosecution, appeal or other proceeding on behalf of the Central Government or State Government?
output: The Public Prosecutor

instruction: When did the substitution of the term 'allowance' in sub-section (2) come into effect according to Act 50 of 2001, s. 2?
output: The substitution came into effect from 24-9-2001.

instruction: What is the maximum term of imprisonment or penalty for a person who knowingly acts contrary to law?
output: The maximum term of imprisonment may extend to seven years, or with a fine, or with both.

instruction: What is the punishment for making, buying or selling instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting Indian coin?
output: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

instruction: Who can the State Government empower to exercise the powers of a Judicial Magistrate in the absence of one in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Lakshadweep, after consulting with the High Court?
output: The State Government may empower any Executive Magistrate (not being a police officer) to exercise the powers conferred by sub-section (1) on a Judicial Magistrate.

instruction: What conditions must be met before the court directs the release of an offender under sub-section (1)?
output: The Court must be satisfied that an offender or his surety (if any) has a fixed place of abode or regular occupation in the place for which the Court acts or in which the offender is likely to live during the period named for the observance of the conditions.

instruction: When would a person who migrated from India to Pakistan after March 1, 1947, still be considered a citizen of India?
output: If they have returned to the territory of India under a permit for resettlement or permanent return issued by or under the authority of any law.

instruction: Which legal documents and sections specify the territories included in Madhya Pradesh?
output: The territories are specified in sub-section (1) of section 9 of the States Reorganisation Act, 1956 and the First Schedule to the Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh (Transfer of Territories) Act, 1959, but not the territories specified in section 3 of the Madhya Pradesh Reorganisation Act, 2000.

instruction: What is the penalty for impersonating a soldier, sailor or airman by wearing their uniform or carrying any of their tokens in India?
output: Imprisonment for months, or fine 500 rupees, or both.

instruction: What act and section substituted the term 'any document' with 'book, electronic record, paper, writing' and when did this occur?
output: It was substituted by Act 21 of 2000, s. 91 and the First Sch., on 17-10-2000.

instruction: What is the form of oath of secrecy for a Minister for a State?
output: “I, A.B., do swear in the name of God that I will not directly or solemnly affirm indirectly communicate or reveal to any person or persons any matter which shall be brought under my consideration or shall become known to me as a Minister for the State of ....................except as may be required for the due discharge of my duties as such Minister.”

instruction: What does section 258 define?
output: Section 258 defines the sale of counterfeit Government stamp as a crime.

instruction: What is the penalty for a person who commits forgery with the intent of harming reputation?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the reason for the Court to serve a notice of forfeiture of property under section 105D?
output: If the Court has reason to believe that all or any of such properties are proceeds of crime as a result of the inquiry, investigation or survey

instruction: Can the President appoint the Governor of a State as the administrator of an adjoining Union territory?
output: Yes, the President may appoint the Governor of a State as the administrator of an adjoining Union territory.

instruction: What does the Constitution state about the jurisdiction of courts concerning the disqualification of a House member?
output: According to the Constitution, no court shall have any jurisdiction in respect of any matter connected with the disqualification of a member of a House.

instruction: What does section 449 specifically focus on?
output: Section 449 focuses on house-trespass in order to commit an offence punishable with death.

instruction: What is the legal term '195A' referring to in the context of witnesses in case of threatening?
output: The procedure for witnesses in case of threatening

instruction: Can the State impose compulsory service for public purposes according to article 23?
output: Yes, nothing in this article shall prevent the State from imposing compulsory service for public purposes.

instruction: What is the punishment for rioting, being armed with a deadly weapon?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What is the offence for a revenue officer who tortures someone to compel them to pay certain arrears of revenue due?
output: The revenue officer is guilty of an offence under this section.

instruction: How should the examination of a confession be recorded according to section 281?
output: The examination of a confession should be recorded in the manner provided in section 281 and should be signed by the person making the confession.

instruction: Who is in charge when someone is charged with an offence punishable with imprisonment for life or imprisonment for 10 years?
output: Magistrate of the first class.

instruction: What can be used as evidence in any inquiry, trial or other proceeding under this Code?

instruction: What does section 291 state about the deposition of a medical witness?

instruction: What are the options a Magistrate can provide to an accused when taking cognizance of a petty offence?

In the latter case, the accused is required to transmit the plea in writing and the amount of fine specified in the summons before the specified date, either by post or by messenger.

instruction: Who can an Executive Magistrate or police officer require assistance from to disperse an assembly, and what can they do if the assembly does not disperse upon command?

instruction: When does the Order of the Administrative Tribunal become effective?

instruction: What is the punishment for defamation against the President, Vice-President, Governor of a State, Administrator of a Union territory or a Minister in respect of his conduct in the discharge of his public functions?

instruction: Is it possible for modifications or exceptions made to an Act of Parliament's application to an autonomous district or region in Mizoram to have retrospective effect?

instruction: When does the imprisonment of a person sentenced to imprisonment for life commence?

instruction: What does 'counterfeit' mean?
output: A person is said to 'counterfeit' who causes one thing to resemble another thing, intending by means of that resemblance to practise deception, or knowing it to be likely that deception will thereby be practised.

instruction: What is the penalty for a person under sentence of a Court of Justice if under sentence of death?
output: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 14 years, with or without fine.

instruction: What happens if the evidence is deficient for an accused person?

instruction: What can the High Court do after withdrawing a case?
output: After withdrawing a case, the High Court can either dispose of the case itself, or determine the said question of law and return the case to the court from which the case has been so withdrawn together with a copy of its judgment on such question. The said court shall on receipt thereof proceed to dispose of the case in conformity with such judgment.

instruction: Who has immunity from arrest for actions committed in the discharge of their official duties?

instruction: What is the significance of the provisions of this Chapter according to 265J?
output: The provisions of this Chapter have effect notwithstanding anything inconsistent therewith contained in any other provisions of this Code and nothing in such other provisions shall be construed to constrain the meaning of any provision of this Chapter.

If before the expiration of that period a resolution disapproving it is passed by the Legislative Assembly and agreed to by the Legislative Council, if any, it ceases to operate upon the passing of the resolution or, as the case may be, on the resolution being agreed to by the Council.

output: This is the definition of assault.

instruction: What happens when a person accepts a tender of pardon made under sub-section (1)?
output: Every person accepting a tender of pardon made under sub-section (1) shall be examined as a witness in the Court of the Magistrate taking cognizance of the offence and in the subsequent trial, if any. Also, unless he is already on bail, he will be detained in custody until the termination of the trial.

instruction: What does a District Planning Committee do with the plans prepared by the Panchayats and the Municipalities in the district?
output: A District Planning Committee consolidates the plans prepared by the Panchayats and the Municipalities in the district and prepares a draft development plan for the district as a whole.

instruction: What was inserted by Act 41 of 2010, s. 2?

instruction: What is a person required to do if they are ordered to stop a trade or occupation that is harmful to public health, or if they are asked to relocate their business or to appear in court?
output: The person, also referred to as the recipient, is required to cease carrying on the said trade or occupation at the place it is currently carried out, and must not restart it. Additionally, they might be required to move the said trade from the current location or to appear in court.

instruction: What conditions need to be satisfied for the Court to order the attachment of property at the time of the issue of the proclamation?
output: The Court needs to be satisfied that the person in relation to whom the proclamation is to be issued is about to dispose of the whole or any part of his property, or is about to remove the whole or any part of his property from the local jurisdiction of the Court.

instruction: What is the punishment for dishonestly or fraudulently signing, executing or becoming a party to any deed or instrument which purports to transfer or subject to any charge any property, and which contains any false statement?

instruction: What might be the consequence if a person A were to give Z fifty strokes with a stick, and could we consider each blow as a separate offence?
output: A might have committed the offence of voluntarily causing hurt to Z by the whole beating, and theoretically also by each of the blows which make up the whole beating. However, if A were liable to punishment for every blow, he might be imprisoned for fifty years, one for each blow. But in reality, he is liable only to one punishment for the whole beating.

instruction: Who can a private person arrest according to section 43?

instruction: How is the tax collected by the Union under clause (1) of article 246A distributed?

instruction: What is the punishment for a person who disobeys quarantine rules?

instruction: According to the clause, who has the final decision in the exercise of individual judgment?

instruction: What is the example of giving false evidence in Illustration (a)?

instruction: What is mentioned under the regulation of arms in the Union List?

instruction: What does the law state about a person committing an act without understanding it due to unsoundness of mind?
output: If a person commits an act at a time when they were incapable of understanding the nature of the act or that it was wrong or contrary to law due to unsoundness of mind, the Magistrate shall proceed with the case. If the accused ought to be tried by the Court of Session, he is committed for trial before the Court of Session.

instruction: What does the court do if a satisfactory disposition of the case has been worked out in a meeting under section 265C?
output: The Court prepares a report of such disposition which is signed by the presiding officer of the Court and all other persons who participated in the meeting.

instruction: What happens if the Magistrate finds the accused guilty but does not proceed in accordance with the provisions of section 325 or section 360?
output: He shall, after hearing the accused on the question, record an order of conviction.

instruction: What classes of Courts of Judicial Magistrates are established in every district not being a metropolitan area?
output: Courts of Judicial Magistrates of the first class and of the second class

instruction: What conditions allow for a person to be charged with and tried for multiple offences at one trial?
output: A person can be charged with more than one offence if, in one series of acts so connected together as to form the same transaction, more offences than one are committed by the same person.

instruction: What are the areas of responsibility listed in the text?
output: Rural development, planning and development, printing and stationery, public health engineering, public works department, publicity and public relations, registration of births and deaths, relief and rehabilitation, sericulture, small, cottage and rural industry, social Welfare, soil conservation, sports and youth welfare, statistics, tourism, transport, tribal research institute, urban development, weights and measures, and welfare of plain tribes and backward classes.

instruction: Why might the President increase the number of Judges in a High Court?

instruction: What is the punishment for rape under the law 376?

instruction: What happens if a person voluntarily acquires citizenship of a foreign state according to Indian law?

instruction: What is the penalty for rendering useless any elephant, camel, horse, etc., or any other animal of the value of 50 rupees or upwards?
output: Imprisonment for 5 years, or fine, or both

instruction: What code is for assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property worn or carried by a person?
