output: The wife, child, father or mother of the person who is the subject of the proceeding.

instruction: What does the President have the power to do according to the text?
output: The President has the power to make incidental and consequential provisions as appear to be necessary and proper.

instruction: Which section covers the disposal of things found in search beyond jurisdiction?
output: Section 101

instruction: Who does the word 'offender' include?
output: The word 'offender' includes any person who is alleged to have been guilty of any such act.

instruction: What does the expression 'Scheduled Areas' mean in this Constitution?
output: Such areas as the President may by order declare to be Scheduled Areas

instruction: What is the punishment for going armed or attempting to go armed during an unlawful assembly or riot?
output: The punishment for going armed or attempting to go armed during an unlawful assembly or riot is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What does the judge do if a witness attendance or document production is requested for the purpose of vexation or delay?
output: The Judge shall refuse the application for such requests if he considers that it is made for the purpose of vexation or delay or for defeating the ends of justice.

instruction: Who are protected from arrest under sections 41 to 44?
output: Members of the Armed Forces are protected from arrest under sections 41 to 44.

instruction: What came into effect on 1-1-1956?
output: The substitution for 'transportation'

instruction: What are the rights of a person against whom proceedings are instituted to be defended?
What is the penalty for personation at an election?
output: Imprisonment for one year, or fine, or both

instruction: What is the consequence for an uncommitted offence?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

instruction: Who can institute a complaint against the President, Vice President, Governor of a State, or a Minister regarding their conduct in public functions?
output: The Public Prosecutor.

instruction: What changes were made to Section 382 in the Union territories of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Lakshadweep?
output: Section 382 was re-numbered as sub-section (1) of that section, and sub-section (1) as so re-numbered, the following provisos and Explanation were added. It is stated that where it is not practicable to file the petition of appeal to the proper Appellate Court, the petition of appeal may be presented to the Administrator or to an Executive Magistrate, not below the rank of Sub-Divisional Magistrate, who shall forward the same to the proper Appellate Court; and, when any such appeal is presented to the Administrator or to an Executive Magistrate, he shall record thereon the date of its date of presentation.

instruction: What does a Bill need to contain to be deemed a Money Bill?
output: A Bill shall be deemed to be a Money Bill if it contains only provisions dealing with all or any of the following matters, namely the imposition, abolition, remission, alteration or regulation of any tax; the regulation of the borrowing of money or the giving of any guarantee by the Government of India, or the amendment of the law with respect to any financial obligations undertaken or to be undertaken.

instruction: What are the qualifications of the members to be nominated by the President?
output: They shall consist of persons having special knowledge or practical experience in respect of such matters as Literature, science, art and social service.

instruction: What can a District Magistrate, Sub-divisional Magistrate or Magistrate of the first class do if they believe a place is used for the deposit or sale of stolen property or objectionable articles?
output: They may by warrant authorise any police officer above the rank of a constable to enter and inspect the place.

instruction: What is the punishment for non-attendance in obedience to an order from a public servant?
output: The punishment is simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

instruction: Which section entails the security for keeping the peace in other cases?
output: Section 107

instruction: What does section 106 provide security for?
output: Keeping the peace on conviction

instruction: Who is accused of voluntarily causing grievous hurt to B by means of an instrument for shooting under the Indian Penal Code?
output: A is accused of this crime under section 326 of the Indian Penal Code.

instruction: What is the status of trade, commerce and intercourse throughout the territory of India?
output: Trade, commerce and intercourse throughout the territory of India shall be free, subject to the other provisions of this Part.

instruction: Which article of the Constitution of India provides the Supreme Court the power to review any judgment pronounced or order made by it, subject to the provisions of any law made by Parliament or any rules made under article 145?
output: Article 137 of the Constitution of India provides this power to the Supreme Court.

instruction: What happens to the proceedings when an order passed under section 446 is revised?
output: If an order passed under section 446 is revised, the proceedings become void.

instruction: Who is required to receive the prisoner into custody and keep him safely until further orders when a sentence is commuted according to Form No. 41?
output: The officer in charge of the jail

instruction: What is the form number for Bond to prosecute or give evidence?
output: FORM NO. 29

instruction: Who is referred to in sub-section (1) that carries out the inquiry, investigation, or survey mentioned in sub-section (2)?
output: An officer

instruction: What code refers to the procedure by Magistrate not competent to take cognizance of the case?
What is the punishment for theft, after preparation having been made for causing death, hurt, restraint, or fear in order to commit the theft?
output: Rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

instruction: What is the numerical representation associated with the entity that has the power to commute a sentence?
Which article allows the President to make regulations for the Union territories of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Lakshadweep, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu, and Puducherry?
output: Article 240

instruction: Who hears the parties, receives evidence, considers the effects of the evidence, takes further evidence if necessary, and decides whether such right exists when pursuing the statements?
output: The magistrate

instruction: Who are the seats in every Panchayat reserved for and how is the proportion determined?
output: Seats in every Panchayat are reserved for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes. The proportion is determined by the population of the Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes in that Panchayat area relative to the total population of that area.

instruction: What is the form of oath or affirmation to be made by a member of the Legislature of a State in India?
output: "I, A.B., having been elected (or nominated) a member of the Legislative Assembly (or Legislative Council), do swear in the name of God that solemnly affirm I will bear true faith and allegiance to the Constitution of India as by law established, that I will uphold the sovereignty and integrity of India and that I will faithfully discharge the duty upon which I am about to enter."

instruction: What is the punishment for someone who knowingly spreads a disease dangerous to life?
output: The person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What is the legal stance on an offence committed by a person who was unknowingly or unwillingly intoxicated and thus incapable of understanding the nature of the act or its legality?
output: Nothing is an offence which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, is, by reason of intoxication, incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong, or contrary to law: provided that the thing which intoxicated him was administered to him without his knowledge or against his will.

instruction: What power does the administrator have during the recess of Legislature in the Union territory of Puducherry?
output: If the administrator is satisfied that circumstances exist which render it necessary for him to take immediate action, he may promulgate such Ordinances as the circumstances appear to him to require, except after obtaining instructions from the President.

instruction: What happens when a summons referred to in clause (a) or clause (c) has been served?
output: The provisions of section 68 shall apply in relation to such summons as if the presiding officer of the Court to whom it is sent were a Magistrate in the said territories

instruction: What type of cases does the Magistrate of the first class handle related to Indian coin?
output: Counterfeiting of Indian coin

instruction: What is a person bound to do under Form No. 3 after an arrest under a warrant?
output: Under Form No. 3, the person is bound to attend court on a specified date to answer to the charge.

instruction: Which section addresses that no inducement is to be offered?
output: Section 163 addresses that no inducement is to be offered.

instruction: What should be done if a magistrate is unable to record the reason of his inability?
output: A memorandum should be made in writing or from his dictation in open court.

instruction: What products, goods, and materials does the Constitution of India specify for trade and commerce where the control of such industry by the Union is declared by Parliament by law to be expedient in the public interest?
output: The Constitution of India specifies trade and commerce in the products of any industry, imported goods of the same kind as such products, foodstuffs including edible oilseeds and oils, cattle fodder including oilcakes and other concentrates, raw cotton whether ginned or unginned and cotton seed, and raw jute.

instruction: What happens to the Chairman of the Union Public Service Commission after ceasing to hold office?
output: The Chairman of the Union Public Service Commission shall be ineligible for further employment either under the Government of India or under the Government of a State.

instruction: What happens after the Court orders a convicted person to be released on bail?
output: The convicted person is released for such period as will afford sufficient time to present the appeal and obtain the orders of the Appellate Court under sub-section (1); the sentence of imprisonment is put on hold, so long as the person remains on bail.

instruction: What is the power of the court regarding summoning persons?
output: 175. Power to summon persons.

instruction: What sections are being substituted in the sentence 'on 376D'?
output: Section 354, section 354A, section 354B, section 354C, section 354D, section 354E, section 376, section 376A, section 376B, section 376C, section 376D, section 376E, section 376F, section 509, section 509A or section 509B

instruction: What does the term 'proclaimed offender' include according to this section of the Indian Penal Code?
output: The term 'proclaimed offender' includes any person proclaimed as an offender by any Court or authority in any territory in India to which this Code does not extend, in respect of any act which if committed in the territories to which this Code extends, would be an offence punishable under certain sections of the Indian Penal Code.

instruction: Under which sections should proceedings not be taken for a person to be exempted from executing a bond for maintaining good behaviour?
output: Section 108, section 109, or section 110

instruction: What does section 255 state about the Magistrate's actions upon taking evidence?
output: If the Magistrate, upon taking the evidence referred to in section 254 and such further evidence, if any, as he may, of his own motion, cause to be produced, finds the accused not guilty, he shall record an order of acquittal.

instruction: What should be taken into consideration in the making of appointments to services and posts in connection with the affairs of the Union or of a State?
output: The claims of the members of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes shall be taken into consideration, consistently with the maintenance of efficiency of administration.

instruction: What happens if the accused refuses to plead or does not plead?
output: The Magistrate fixes a date for the examination of witnesses.

instruction: What is the minimum number of members required for the Legislative Assembly of the State of Mizoram?
output: Not less than forty members

instruction: What was substituted for the words, brackets, figure, “sub-section (7)” in sub-section (9)?
output: The words, brackets, figures and letter “sub-section (6-A) and sub-section (7)”

instruction: What is the penalty for voluntarily causing grievous hurt to extort property or a valuable security?
output: Imprisonment for life and fine.

instruction: Who must recommend for the President to declare that an article shall cease to be operative or be operative only with exceptions and modifications?
output: The Constituent Assembly of the State referred to in clause (2) must recommend.

instruction: What is the punishment for the crimes mentioned in section 467?
output: The punishment is imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description, for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the term of imprisonment or other penalties for someone who has committed an offence for which the longest term of imprisonment provided does not exceed ten years?
output: The person shall be punished with imprisonment of the description provided for the offence for a term which may extend to one-fourth part of the longest term of imprisonment provided for the offence, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What should the court take into account when awarding compensation in a civil suit?
output: The court should consider any sum paid or recovered as compensation under this section.

instruction: What is the condition for the Appellate Court to release a convicted person on bail or on his own bond?
output: The Appellate Court shall, before releasing on bail or on his own bond a convicted person who is convicted of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life or imprisonment for a term of not less than ten years, shall give opportunity to the Public Prosecutor for showing cause in writing against such release.

instruction: Who is responsible for transmitting the records of the case and diary entries to the Judicial Magistrate?
output: The officer in charge of the police station or the police officer making the investigation

instruction: What is the penalty for an individual who knowingly partakes in mass drills or training with arms, or carries weapons in a demonstration?
output: Imprisonment for one month, or fine of 100 rupees or both.

instruction: On whose advice does the Governor appoint the other Ministers?
output: The Chief Minister

instruction: What is the punishment for violating the condition of remission of punishment?
output: The punishment is the punishment to which the person was originally sentenced, if he has already suffered no part of that punishment, and if he has suffered any part of that punishment, then with so much of that punishment as he has not already suffered.

instruction: Who does a member of the panchayat of the village include?
output: The term 'officer employed in connection with the affairs of the village' refers to a member of the panchayat of the village which includes the headman and every officer or other person appointed to perform any function connected with the administration of the village.

instruction: Who has the power to grant pardons, reprieves, respites or remissions of punishment or to suspend, remit or commute the sentence of any person convicted of any offence?
output: The President

instruction: What is included in the matters specified in sub-clauses (a) to (h)?
output: Ceiling on urban property, elections to either House of Parliament or the House or either House of the Legislature of a State, production, procurement, supply and distribution of food-stuffs and such other goods as the President may declare to be essential goods, rent, its regulation and control and tenancy issues including the right, title and interest of landlords and tenants, offences against laws with respect to any of the matters specified in these sub-clauses, and any matter incidental to these matters.

instruction: What conditions need to be met for a person to be released on bail after sixty days?
output: The person needs to be in custody during the whole of the said period of sixty days.

instruction: Is the offence of counterfeiting coin bailable or non-bailable?
output: Non-bailable

instruction: What happens to someone who assaults, threatens to assault, obstructs or attempts to obstruct a public servant while they are trying to disperse an unlawful assembly or suppress a riot or affray?
output: They shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend.

instruction: What happens at the expiration of the five year period of the Assembly?
output: The expiration of the five year period shall operate as a dissolution of the Assembly.

instruction: What are the powers, authority and responsibilities of Municipalities according to the Constitution of India?
output: The Legislature of a State may endow the Municipalities with such powers and authority as may be necessary to enable them to function as institutions of self-government. This may include the preparation of plans for economic development and social justice, the performance of functions and the implementation of schemes as may be entrusted to them, including those related to the matters listed in the Twelfth Schedule.

instruction: What is the annual tax limit that can be paid by any one person to the State or to any one municipality, district board, local board or other local authority in the State on professions, trades, callings and employments?
output: Two thousand and five hundred rupees

instruction: What words are to be substituted in sub-section (2) of Section 197 of the Code in Assam?
output: in or in connection with the discharge of

instruction: Who has the power to determine the number of members and their conditions of service in a Union Commission?
output: The President

instruction: What is the responsibility of the Union in terms of industries as declared by the Parliament by law?
output: The Union is responsible for the control of industries if declared by Parliament by law to be expedient in the public interest.

instruction: What does the expression 'final order' include according to the Constitution of India?
output: The expression 'final order' includes an order deciding an issue which, if decided in favour of the appellant, would be sufficient for the final disposal of the case.

instruction: What is the West Bengal Act XXIV of 1978 commonly known as?
output: It is commonly known as the West Bengal Restoration of Alienated Land (Amendment) Act, 1978.

instruction: What happens if an investigation is not concluded within six months from the date the accused was arrested?
output: The Magistrate shall make an order stopping further investigation into the offence unless the officer making the investigation satisfies the Magistrate that for special reasons and in the interests of justice the continuation of the investigation beyond

instruction: What is the court's procedure if the prosecution or the accused apply regarding the subject-matter of a report?
output: The Court is obligated to summon and examine such Magistrate as to the subject-matter of the said report.

instruction: What can the Court do if a property under sub-section (1) is suspected to be in a contracting State?
output: The Court may issue a letter of request to a Court or an authority in the contracting State for execution of such order.

instruction: Does anything in this article prevent Parliament from making a law that prescribes a requirement as to residence within a State or Union territory prior to such employment or appointment?
output: No, nothing in this article prevents Parliament from making such a law.

instruction: Who may the summons or warrant be directed to?
output: Such Court, Judge or Magistrate

instruction: Who is legally bound to give information about planned robberies and what would be considered an illegal omission on their part?
output: An officer of police is legally bound to give information of all designs to commit robbery which may come to his knowledge. An illegal omission would be if they knew someone planned to commit a robbery and intentionally didn't give this information, with the intent to facilitate the commission of that offence.

instruction: Who is a person who by habit is a robber, house-breaker, thief, or forger?
output: A habitual robber, house-breaker, thief, or forger is described as such a person.

instruction: How can a Proclamation issued under clause (1) be revoked or altered?
output: By a subsequent Proclamation

instruction: What must the Magistrate provide to the accused in advance?
output: The Magistrate must supply the statement of witnesses recorded during the investigation by the police.

instruction: What is wrongful confinement to extort confession or compel restoration of property?
output: It is when a person wrongfully confines any person for the purpose of extorting from the person confined or any person interested in the person confined any confession or any information which may lead to the detection of an offence or misconduct, or for the purpose of constraining the person confined or any person interested in the person confined to restore or to cause the restoration of any property or valuable security or to satisfy any claim or demand, or to give information which may lead to the restoration of any property or valuable security.

instruction: What is the consequence of refusing to give name and residence according to section 42?
output: According to section 42, if a person refuses to give their name and residence, they can be arrested.

instruction: What may the forms set forth in the Second Schedule be used for?
output: The forms set forth in the Second Schedule may be used for the respective purposes therein mentioned, with variations as the circumstances of each case require.

instruction: Who can try the case, refer it to a subordinate with jurisdiction, or commit the accused for trial if empowered to do so?
output: The Magistrate to whom the case is submitted can do this.

instruction: What effect does an amendment of any law for the time being in force have on the dissolution of a Municipality at any level?
output: No amendment of any law for the time being in force shall have the effect of causing dissolution of a Municipality at any level.

instruction: What can any Magistrate do at any time within his local jurisdiction?
output: He may at any time arrest or direct the arrest, in his presence, of any person for whose arrest he is competent at the time and in the circumstances to issue a warrant.

instruction: What conditions must be met for Parliament to extend the provisions of this Part to the Scheduled Areas and the tribal areas referred to in clause (1)?
output: The conditions must be subject to such exceptions and modifications as may be specified in such law.

instruction: Can a person be a member of Parliament and of a House of the Legislature of a State?
output: No, a person shall not be a member both of Parliament and of a House of the Legislature of a State.

instruction: What is required for a resolution to be passed for the continuance in force of a Proclamation beyond the expiration of one year, particularly in relation to the operation of a Proclamation of Emergency and the certification from the Election Commission?
output: For a resolution to be passed for the continuance in force of a Proclamation beyond the expiration of one year, a Proclamation of Emergency must be in operation in the whole of India or, as the case may be, in the whole or any part of the State at the time of the passing of such resolution. Additionally, the Election Commission must certify that the continuance in force of the Proclamation approved under clause (3) during the period specified in such resolution is necessary due to difficulties in holding general elections to the Legislative Assembly of the State concerned.

instruction: What happens to laws in force in the territory of India immediately before the commencement of the Constitution?
output: All the laws in force in the territory of India immediately before the commencement of this Constitution shall continue in force therein until altered or repealed or amended by a competent Legislature or other competent authority.

instruction: How should evidence be recorded in a case?
output: The evidence should be recorded in the manner prescribed for summons-cases.

instruction: What are the restrictions on a person who fails to deny the existence of a public right or fails to provide reliable evidence in support of such denial?
output: A person who fails to deny the existence of a public right or who, having made such denial, has failed to adduce reliable evidence in support thereof, shall not in the subsequent proceedings be permitted to make any such denial.

instruction: What type of imprisonment can the court impose in default of payment of a fine?
output: The imprisonment which the Court imposes in default of payment of a fine may be of any description to which the offender might have been sentenced for the offence.

instruction: Who does the juryman, assessor, or member of a panchayat assisting a Court of Justice or public servant represent?
output: They are authorised by a Court of Justice to perform duties.

instruction: What does a document purporting to be a report under the hand of a Government scientific expert upon any matter or thing duly submitted to him for examination or analysis and report in the course of any proceeding under this Code, serve as in an inquiry, trial or other proceeding under this Code?
output: It can be used as evidence.

instruction: What is discussed in section 251?
output: Section 251 discusses the necessity for the substance of accusation to be stated.

instruction: What is the numerical code associated with proving a previous conviction or acquittal?
What is meant by 'proceeds of crime'?
output: Any property derived or obtained directly or indirectly, by any person as a result of criminal activity (including crime involving currency transfers) or the value of any such property.

instruction: What is the type of crime for making or possessing machinery, instrument or material for forging or counterfeiting currency?
output: Non-cognizable

instruction: What can the Court of a Chief Judicial Magistrate do if a claim or objection is made in his court?
output: He may make it over for disposal to any Magistrate subordinate to him.

instruction: What is the punishment mentioned in the third instance?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: Which act is referred to as the Rajasthan Tenancy (Amendment) Act, 1976?
output: The Rajasthan Act 12 of 1976

instruction: What is the maximum term for imprisonment or the alternative punishment for causing harm using dangerous weapons?
output: The maximum term for causing harm using dangerous weapons can be imprisonment for life, or alternatively, imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, along with a fine.

instruction: Which section of law is defined as 'Assault or criminal force on grave provocation'?
output: Section 358

instruction: What does the law state about trying or inquiring into an offence committed outside the jurisdiction of a Magistrate, that cannot be inquired into or tried within the jurisdiction as per sections 177 to 185, or any other existing law but is under some law for the time being in force triable in India?
output: According to Section 187, an offence committed outside of the magistrate's jurisdiction can be inquired into or tried within such jurisdiction under these conditions.

instruction: What changes were made to section 383 concerning the forwarding of petitions of appeal and copies to the Administrator or an Executive Magistrate, not below the rank of a Sub-Divisional Magistrate, in case of weather, transport or other difficulties in the Union territories of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Lakshadweep?
output: The amendment made to section 383 was the insertion of the following words at the end, 'or if, by reason of the weather, transport or other difficulties, it is not possible to forward them to the proper Appellate Court they shall be forwarded to the Administrator or an Executive Magistrate, not below the rank of a Sub-Divisional Magistrate, who shall, on receipt of such petition of appeal and copies, record thereon'

instruction: What alternatives does a person have if they are required to execute a bond by a court or officer?
output: They may be permitted to deposit a sum of money or Government promissory notes to such amount as the court or officer may fix in lieu of executing such bond.

instruction: Which court handles cases of rape by a person in a position of trust or authority?
output: Any Magistrate.

instruction: What does the code '329' refer to in the context of a court trial?
output: 329 refers to the procedure in case of person of unsound mind tried before Court.

instruction: Who recommendation is required for a demand for a grant to be made?
output: The Governor

instruction: What are the conditions where the Legislature of a State has prescribed any language other than the English language for use in Bills?
output: The conditions are not specified in the provided text.

instruction: What punishment is given to a person who intentionally fails to attend a specific place or time when legally bound to do so?
output: The person shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

instruction: Under what conditions can an officer in charge of a police station or a police officer making an investigation under this Chapter search a place in the limits of another police station?
output: They can search a place in the limits of another police station if there is a reason to believe that delay might result in evidence being concealed or destroyed.

instruction: Under which section of the Indian Penal Code can a person be separately charged with, and convicted of, the possession of each seal?
output: Section 473 of the Indian Penal Code.

instruction: Under what circumstances can restrictions be imposed on the freedom of trade, commerce or intercourse?
output: If it is required in the public interest.

instruction: What is the procedure described in section 457?
output: Section 457 describes the procedure by police upon seizure of property.

instruction: What type of crime is classified as non-cognizable and bailable?
output: The crime of intentional insult or interruption to a public servant in a judicial proceeding

instruction: Is it necessary that any act or illegal omission shall take place in pursuance thereof to constitute a conspiracy?
output: No, it is not necessary.

instruction: What are the special provisions about financial Bills?
output: A Bill or amendment making provision for any of the matters specified in sub-clauses (a) to (f) of clause (1) of article 199 shall not be introduced or moved except on the recommendation of the Governor, and a Bill making such provision shall not be introduced in a Legislative Council. However, no recommendation shall be required for the moving of an amendment making provision for the reduction or abolition of any tax.

instruction: When is an Ordinance under this article void?
output: If and so far as an Ordinance under this article makes any provision which would not be valid if enacted in an Act of the Legislature of the State assented to by the Governor, it shall be void.

instruction: What is the Madhya Pradesh Act 1 of 1984?
output: The Madhya Pradesh Ceiling on Agricultural Holdings (Second Amendment) Act, 1976

instruction: What is excluded from the matters listed in the fees?
output: Fees taken in any court

instruction: What is the punishment for the fraudulent removal or concealment of property of oneself or another individual?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: Can either House of Parliament act despite any vacancy in the membership thereof?
output: Yes, either House of Parliament shall have power to act notwithstanding any vacancy in the membership thereof.

instruction: Is the law mentioned in sub-paragraph (1) of this paragraph considered an amendment of the Constitution?
output: No, such law shall not be deemed to be an amendment of this Constitution for the purposes of article 368.

instruction: What is rule 87 about?
output: Rule 87 is about the issue of warrant in lieu of, or in addition to, summons.

instruction: What does the sentence of imprisonment for life and a fine mean in relation to a person convicted of trafficking a minor multiple times?
output: It means the person is sentenced to spend the remainder of their natural life in prison, and also pay a fine.

instruction: What is the definition of a 'registered medical practitioner' according to the text?
output: A medical practitioner who possesses any medical qualification as defined in clause (h) of section 2 of the Indian Medical Council Act, 1956 (102 of 1956) and whose name has been entered in a State Medical Register.

instruction: What is the punishment for assault or criminal force without grave provocation?
output: The punishment can be imprisonment for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

instruction: Who is a member of a Wards Committee within the territorial area they represent in a Municipality?
output: A member of a Municipality representing a ward within that territorial area is a member of the Wards Committee.

instruction: Can any provision be made in favour of the members of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes?
output: Yes, nothing in this article shall prevent in making of any provision in favour of the members of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes.

instruction: Is the power to suspend, remit or commute a sentence of death exercisable by the Governor of a State under any law for the time being in force unaffected by sub-clause (c) of clause (1)?
output: Yes

instruction: What words should be inserted after 'whether an accused person was produced before the Magistrate' in Explanation II?
output: The words 'in person or, as the case may be, through the medium of electronic video linkage' should be inserted.

instruction: What does it mean when five or more persons are assembled with a specific intent?
output: It means they are committing dacoity.

instruction: Who may by law impose restrictions on the freedom of trade, commerce or intercourse?
output: Parliament has the power to impose restrictions on trade, commerce and intercourse.

instruction: What does the Act 25 of 2005, s. 35 state about the circumstances under which a person cannot be released on bail?
output: The Act states that a person cannot be released on bail if there appear reasonable grounds for believing that he has been guilty of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life, or if the offence is a cognizable offence and he had been previously convicted of an offence punishable with death, imprisonment for life or imprisonment for seven years or more.

instruction: What is the explanation given for section 81?
output: It is a question of fact in such a case whether the harm to be prevented or avoided was of such a nature and so imminent as to justify or excuse the risk of doing the act with the knowledge that it was likely to cause harm.

instruction: What does clause (b) of section 209 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 state?
output: It states that the accused is to be remanded to custody during, and until the conclusion of, the trial.

instruction: What is the classification of the crime of detaining a married woman with criminal intent?
output: Non-cognizable

instruction: Which section of the law states the offence of sale, etc., of obscene books, etc.?
output: Section 292

instruction: What is the category of the crime according to the 5th rule?
output: Bailable

instruction: What does the term 'Government' refer to when it is authorized by law to administer executive government in any part of India, Her Majesty's dominions or any foreign country?
output: In sections 255 to 263, the term 'Government' refers to such an entity.

instruction: What is the basis for the number of seats reserved for the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes in the Legislative Assembly of any State?
output: The population of the Scheduled Castes in the State or of the Scheduled Tribes in the State or part of the State, in respect of which seats are so reserved, bears to the total population of the State

instruction: What were the changes made by Act 50 of 2001, s. 3?
output: Act 50 of 2001, s. 3 replaced the term 'maintenance' with 'monthly allowance for the maintenance and interim maintenance or any of them' and it came into effect from 24-9-2001.

instruction: What entity is responsible for determining the language of each Court within the State other than the High Court?
output: The State Government

instruction: What type of cases does the Court of Session handle related to government stamps?
output: The Court of Session handles cases of counterfeiting a Government stamp.

instruction: What information is required in Form No. 10?
output: Form No. 10 requires the name and designation of the officer executing the warrant, the offense or suspected offense, a clear specification of the thing to be searched for, a description of the location where the search is to be conducted, the date, and the signature and seal of the court.

instruction: What does 'securities' include according to the constitutional definition?
output: 'Securities' includes stock.

instruction: What part of the estimates is not submitted to the vote of the Legislative Assembly and what part is submitted for approval?
output: So much of the estimates as relates to expenditure charged upon the Consolidated Fund of a State shall not be submitted to the vote of the Legislative Assembly, however, this doesn't prevent the discussion of any of those estimates in the Legislature. The part of the estimates that relates to other expenditure is submitted to the Legislature for approval.

instruction: Who can make an order for the immediate restoration of an abducted or unlawfully detained woman or female child under the age of eighteen?
output: A District Magistrate, Sub-divisional Magistrate or Magistrate of the first class

instruction: What happens when powers and duties have been conferred or imposed upon a State or officers or authorities thereof under article 258?
output: Under article 258, if powers and duties have been conferred or imposed upon a State or officers or authorities thereof, the Government of India shall pay the State such sum as may be agreed, or, in default of agreement, as may be determined by an arbitrator appointed by the Chief Justice of India, in respect of any extra costs of administration incurred by the State in connection with the exercise of those powers and duties.

instruction: What is deemed to be less severe in kind compared to a sentence of rigorous imprisonment under sub-section (2)?
output: A sentence of simple imprisonment is deemed to be less severe in kind than a sentence of rigorous imprisonment.

instruction: What are some of the topics included in the Eleventh Schedule such as Agriculture, Land improvement, Minor irrigation, and Animal husbandry?
output: The Eleventh Schedule includes topics such as Agriculture, Land improvement, Minor irrigation, Animal husbandry, Fisheries, Social forestry, Minor forest produce, Small scale industries, Rural housing, Drinking water, Roads, Rural electrification, Poverty alleviation programme, Education, Technical training, Libraries, Cultural activities, Health and sanitation, Family welfare, Women and child development, Social welfare, and Welfare of the weaker sections.

instruction: Which form is about Charges, which can be with one head, two or more heads, or for theft after previous conviction?
output: Form No. 32 is about such charges.

instruction: How are the seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in a Municipality determined and allocated?
output: Seats shall be reserved for the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes in every Municipality and the number of seats so reserved shall bear the same proportion to the total number of seats to be filled by direct election in that Municipality as the population of the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes in the Municipal area bears to the total population of that area. These seats may be allotted by rotation to different constituencies in a Municipality.

instruction: Is it necessary for this offence that the offender is aware their actions may result in death?
output: No, the offender does not need to know that their actions could possibly lead to death for this specific offence.

instruction: What does the Parliament for the Union consist of?
output: The President and two Houses known respectively as the Council of States and the House of the People.

instruction: Who does the term 'accused' include as per the Code of Criminal Procedure?
output: The term 'accused' includes a person in relation to whom any proceeding under Chapter VIII has been commenced under the Code.

instruction: What is the potential penalty for someone who is found guilty of causing harm using fire, poison, corrosive substance, explosive substance, or any substance harmful to the human body?
output: The punishment can range from imprisonment for a term which may extend to ten years, or with imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the status of a statement made by such person accepting the tender of pardon?
output: Any statement made by such person accepting the tender of pardon and recorded by a Magistrate under section 164 or by a Court under sub-section (4) of section 306 may be given in evidence against him at such trial.

instruction: Which section describes the crime of fraudulent cancellation, destruction, etc., of will, authority to adopt, or valuable security?
output: Section 477 describes this crime.

instruction: Within what period should the Council reconsider a law that has been returned?
output: The Council should reconsider the law within a period of six months.

instruction: What do the terms 'Communtation of sentence of death' and 'Communtation of sentence of imprisonment' generally refer to?
output: These terms generally refer to the reduction of the severity of a penalty or sentence of death or imprisonment.

instruction: In what clause and section is the value of the property in respect of which the offence has been committed recorded?
output: It is recorded in cases coming under clause (ii), clause (iii) or clause (iv) of sub-section (1) of section 260.

instruction: What can the President do if a Bill is rejected by one House, the Houses disagree on the amendments, or more than six months pass without the Bill being passed?
output: The President may notify to the Houses his intention to summon them to meet.

instruction: What is the penalty for dealing with any poisonous substance so as to endanger human life, etc. under code 284?
output: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

instruction: Who can vacate the direction of proceedings according to sub-section (6)?
output: The Sessions Judge

instruction: What was A's intent when he had his child cut for the stone by a surgeon, knowing it could cause his child's death?
output: A's intent was not to cause his child's death but to cure his child. He did it in good faith and for his child's benefit, and hence he is within the exception.

instruction: What types of offenses require the State Government to consult with the Central Government before remitting or commuting a sentence?
output: Offenses that were investigated by the Delhi Special Police Establishment or any other agency empowered to make investigation into an offence under any Central Act other than this Code, or offenses that involved the misappropriation or destruction of, or damage to, any property belonging to the Central Government.

instruction: What can a court order when imposing a sentence where a fine is not a part of the sentence?
output: The court may order the accused person to pay, by way of compensation, an amount specified in the order to the person who has suffered any loss or injury by reason of the act for which the accused person has been sentenced.

instruction: What does the law prescribe as punishment for not producing or delivering up a required document or electronic record to a Court of Justice?
output: The law prescribes simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both.

instruction: What is the 'annual financial statement' referred to in this text?
output: The 'annual financial statement' is a statement of the estimated receipts and expenditure of the Government of India for each financial year, which the President causes to be laid before both the Houses of Parliament.

instruction: What is section 105 about?
output: Reciprocal arrangements regarding processes.

instruction: Who is the Director of Prosecution administratively controlled by in the State?
output: The Director of Prosecution is administratively controlled by the Head of the Home Department in the State.

instruction: What does act 95 deal with?
output: Act 95 deals with an act causing slight harm.

instruction: What was substituted by Act 10 of 2009, s. 51?
output: The term 'digital signature' was substituted.

instruction: What should happen when an appeal has been filed against a sentence passed under certain sections of the Indian Penal Code?
output: The appeal shall be disposed of within a period of six months from the date of filing of such appeal.

instruction: What is the punishment for a party to a criminal conspiracy other than a criminal conspiracy to commit an offence punishable by death or rigorous imprisonment for a term of two years or upwards?
output: They shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term not exceeding six months, or with fine or with both.

instruction: Can the salary of a Comptroller and Auditor-General be varied to his disadvantage after his appointment?
output: No

instruction: What is the crime outlined in Section 319?
output: Hurt

instruction: Under what circumstances can the President remove from office the Chairman or any other member of a Public Service Commission, disregarding clause (1)?
output: If the Chairman or such other member is adjudged an insolvent, engages during his term of office in any paid employment outside the duties of his office, or is, in the opinion of the President, unfit to continue in office by reason of infirmity of mind or body.

instruction: Does the constituent power of Parliament to amend by way of addition, variation or repeal the provisions of the Constitution under this article have any limitations?
output: No, there is no limitation whatever on the power of Parliament to amend the Constitution.

instruction: Which chapter covers processes to compel the production of things?
output: Processes to compel the production of things are covered under Chapter VII.

instruction: What is the form of oath or affirmation to be made by the Judges of the Supreme Court and the Comptroller and Auditor-General of India?
output: “I, A.B., having been appointed Chief Justice (or a Judge) of the Supreme Court of India (or Comptroller and Auditor-General of India) do swear in the name of God that I will bear true faith and solemnly affirm faith and allegiance to the Constitution of India as by law established, that I will uphold the sovereignty and integrity of India, that I will duly and faithfully and to the best of my ability, knowledge and judgment perform the duties of my office without fear or favour, affection or ill-will and that I will uphold the Constitution and the laws.”

instruction: Who can use a part of a witness's statement in an inquiry or trial according to the Indian Evidence Act, 1872, and under what conditions?
output: Any part of his statement may be used by the accused if duly proved. With the permission of the Court, the prosecution can also use it to contradict such witness in the manner provided by section 145 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872.

instruction: What does the Territorial divisions clause say about the composition of each state and sessions divisions?
output: Every State shall be a sessions division or shall consist of sessions divisions; and every sessions divisions shall, for the purposes of this Code, be a district or consist of districts.

instruction: Can a Court take cognizance of any offence punishable under Chapter VI or under section 153A?
output: No, a Court shall not take cognizance of any offence punishable under Chapter VI or under section 153A.

instruction: What is the purpose of section 111?
output: Order to be made.

instruction: What does an officer need to do when required to arrest someone without a warrant?
output: The officer needs to deliver to the officer required to make the arrest an order in writing, specifying the person to be arrested and the offence or other cause for which the arrest is to be made. The officer is also required to notify the person to be arrested the substance of the order and, if so required by such person, shall show him the order.

instruction: What are the conditions for preventive detention for more than three months?
output: No law providing for preventive detention shall authorise the detention of a person for a longer period than three months unless an Advisory Board consisting of persons who are, or have been, or are qualified to be appointed as, Judges of a High Court has reported before the expiration of the said period of three months.

instruction: When was the new section 480A inserted into the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 by Karnataka?
output: The new section 480A was inserted by Karnataka Act 35 of 1984, s. 2.

instruction: What should the Magistrate do if the evidence made out against the accused, if unrebutted, would warrant his conviction?
output: The Magistrate shall discharge him.

instruction: Who can the High Court confer powers of a Metropolitan Magistrate upon?
output: Any person who holds or has held any post under the Government.

instruction: Which section focuses on appeals from convictions?
output: Section 374 focuses on appeals from convictions.

instruction: Which Act was sectioned in West Bengal in 2004?
output: West Bengal Act 20 of 2004 was sectioned in 2004.

instruction: Which section of the Code of Criminal Procedure deals with the conditions under which bail can be granted in case of a non-bailable offence?
Under what section and in what capacity can a High Court or Court of Session allow any person to compound any offence?
output: A High Court or Court of Session can allow a person to compound any offence while acting in the exercise of its powers of revision under section 401.

instruction: What happens if a discussion about the conduct of a Judge of the Supreme Court or of a High Court in the discharge of his duties is initiated in Parliament?
output: According to article 121, no discussion shall take place in Parliament with respect to the conduct of any Judge of the Supreme Court or of a High Court in the discharge of his duties.

instruction: What might a Criminal Court do to a person who refuses to answer questions or produce documents?
output: Such Court may sentence him to simple imprisonment, or commit him to the custody of an officer of the Court for any term not exceeding seven days.

instruction: In an emergency, if a surgeon operates on a child for their benefit without a guardian's consent, is it considered an offence?
output: No, if the surgeon is acting in good faith for the child's benefit, he/she has committed no offence.

instruction: What is deemed an offence under section 187 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: Refusing or neglecting to attend and witness a search under this section, when called upon to do so by an order in writing

instruction: What actions is the District Magistrate/Collector able to take under clauses (a) and (c) of sub-section (4) of section 83 as per Form No. 8?
output: The District Magistrate/Collector is able to cause the said land to be attached and held under attachment pending the further order of this Court. They are also able to certify without delay what they may have done in pursuance of this order.

instruction: What was substituted by Act 26 of 1955, s. 117 and the Sch.?
output: Transportation

instruction: What is the disqualification for appointment on remunerative political post?
output: A member of a House belonging to any political party who is disqualified for being a member of the House under paragraph 2 of the Tenth Schedule shall also be disqualified to hold any remunerative political post for duration of the period commencing from the date of his disqualification till the date on which the term of his office as such member would expire or till the date on which he contests an election to a House and is declared elected, whichever is earlier.

instruction: What is the penalty in Orissa for a crime that involves adulterating food or drink intended for sale?
output: Imprisonment for life and fine.

instruction: Who is responsible for laying a financial statement before the House or Houses every financial year?
output: The Governor is responsible for laying a financial statement before the House or Houses every financial year.

instruction: What is the meaning of 'Causing grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation'?
output: This refers to causing severe physical harm to someone in response to a serious and unexpected provocation, with the intention of hurting only the person who gave the provocation.

instruction: What happens when there is a casual vacancy on the board?
output: The board may fill a casual vacancy on the board by nomination out of the same class of members in respect of which the casual vacancy has arisen, if the term of office of the board is less than half of its original term.

instruction: What is FORM NO. 25?
output: Magistrate’s order declaring party entitled to retain possession of land, etc., in dispute.

instruction: What is the role of the superintendence in relation to Elections to the Municipalities in article 243ZA?
output: The superintendence has the direction and control of the preparation of electoral rolls for the Municipalities.

instruction: What is the punishment for making or possessing counterfeit seals with the intent to commit forgery under any section other than 467?
output: The person shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: Who is referred to as a person who is alleged to have been guilty of any such act?
output: A person who is alleged to have been guilty of any such act is referred to as an 'offender'.

instruction: What is the maximum punishment for house-trespass?
output: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 10 years and fine.

instruction: What is the provision made under Part XVI?
output: Special provisions relating to certain classes

instruction: What should a person or police officer do before entering an apartment occupied by a woman?
output: The person or police officer should give notice to the female that she is at liberty to withdraw and shall afford her every reasonable facility for withdrawing, then they may break open the apartment and enter it.

instruction: What is the definition of an act that is not considered an offence under section 80?
output: An act done by accident or misfortune, without any criminal intention or knowledge, in the doing of a lawful act in a lawful manner by lawful means and with proper care and caution.

instruction: What are the conditions under which a police officer cannot be appointed as the Assistant Public Prosecutor by the District Magistrate?
output: A police officer cannot be appointed if he has taken part in the investigation into the offence or if he is below the rank of Inspector.

instruction: What is the topic of section 415?
output: Section 415 is about cheating.

instruction: What is the Supreme Court of India comprised of?
output: The Supreme Court of India consists of a Chief Justice of India and, until Parliament by law prescribes a larger number, of not more than seven other Judges.

instruction: What words are substituted for the word 'Magistrate' at the first two places where that word is preceded by the definite article according to Assam Act 3 of 1984 in sub-section (2) of Section 167 of the Code?
output: The words 'Judicial Magistrate or the Executive Magistrate, as the case may be,' are substituted.

instruction: Can an accused person be tried for any number of charges at once related to a single act or series of acts under the Indian Penal Code?
output: Yes, the accused may be charged with having committed all or any of several offences for a single act under the Indian Penal Code and all such charges may be tried at once.

instruction: What happens when the period of detention authorised by the Executive Magistrate expires?
output: The accused person is released on bail, unless an order for further detention has been made by a Magistrate competent to make such an order.

instruction: What is considered house-breaking according to the provided text?
output: House-breaking is considered when a person enters or quits a house by using criminal force, committing an assault, threatening any person with assault, or by opening any lock in order to commit the trespass. It also includes entering or quitting by any passage known to have been fastened against such entrance or departure and unfastened by the trespasser or an abettor.

instruction: What are the reasons for preventive detention?
output: Reasons connected with Defence, Foreign Affairs, or the security of India.

instruction: What are the consequences of making a false return, not providing necessary information, disobeying summons or lawful orders, failing to pay a co-operative society within a specified time, or not handing over custody of books, accounts, and other properties to an authorised person?
output: These acts or omissions are considered as offences under the law made by the Legislature of a State.

instruction: What does section 491 pertain to?
output: Section 491 pertains to a person being bound to attend on or supply the wants of a person who is helpless from youth, unsoundness of mind, or disease, and voluntarily omitting to do so.

instruction: What action does the Magistrate take when an application to discharge the bond is made?
output: The Magistrate shall issue his warrant of arrest directing that the person so released be brought before him.

instruction: What is required for an amendment of any such law to have effect?
output: The amendment must be passed in each House of Parliament by not less than two-thirds of the members present and voting.

instruction: Who has the authority to prescribe an order before and after a Finance Commission has been constituted?
output: The President

instruction: What is added to section 278 after sub-section (3) in the amendment to the principal Act in Gujarat?
output: The following sub-sections are added: — '(4) Nothing contained in sub-sections (1) to (3) shall apply when the evidence under section 273 is taken through the medium of Electronic Video Linkage. (5) The evidence taken through the medium of Electronic Video Linkage in electronic from shall be the electronic record within the meaning of clause (t) of section 2 if the Information Technology Act, 2000 (21 of 2000)'

instruction: What additional functions may an Act made by Parliament or the Legislature of a State provide for the Union Public Service Commission or the State Public Service Commission to exercise?
output: The Act may provide for the exercise of additional functions as respects the services of the Union or the State and also as respects the services of any local authority or other body corporate constituted by law or of any public institution.

instruction: Who makes up the Election Commission?
output: The Election Commission consists of the Chief Election Commissioner and such number of other Election Commissioners, if any, as the President may from time to time fix.

instruction: Has A committed any offence if he accidentally kills Z while trying to save him from a tiger?
output: No, A has committed no offence.

instruction: When is an accused informed that he is entitled to have the case inquired into or tried by another according to Section 191?
output: When a Magistrate takes cognizance of an offence under clause (c) of sub-section (1) of section 190, before any evidence is taken.

instruction: Who is competent to issue a search-warrant and direct a search to be made in his presence of any place according to the Code?
output: Any Magistrate according to section 103 of the Code.

instruction: What happens when a notice of prosecution for an offence has been given?
output: In computing the period of limitation, the period of such notice or, as the case may be, the time required for obtaining such consent or sanction is excluded.

instruction: Are Judges and Magistrates allowed to try certain offences when committed before themselves?
output: Except as provided in sections 344, 345, 349 and 350, no Judge of a Criminal Court or Magistrate shall try any person for any offence referred to in section 195, when such offence is committed before himself or in contempt of his authority.

instruction: What is the punishment for counterfeiting, or performing any part of the process of counterfeiting, coin?
output: Imprisonment for 7 years and fine.

instruction: What is the definition of 'summons-case'?
output: A case relating to an offence, and not being a warrant-case

instruction: What is the categorisation of the offence 'public servant disobeying a direction of law with intent to save person from punishment, or property from forfeiture'?
output: Non-cognizable

instruction: In what types of disputes does the Supreme Court have original jurisdiction?
output: The Supreme Court has original jurisdiction in any dispute between the Government of India and one or more States, between the Government of India and any State or States on one side and one or more other States on the other, or between two or more States, if and in so far as the dispute involves any question.

instruction: What is the temporary power given to Parliament under section 369?
output: Parliament has the temporary power to make laws with respect to certain matters in the State List as if they were matters in the Concurrent List for a period of five years from the commencement of this Constitution.

instruction: What does the police do upon completion of an investigation?
output: 173. Report of police officer on completion of investigation.

instruction: What is a 'local law'?
output: A 'local law' is a law applicable only to a particular part of India.

instruction: What is the formal name for the Tamil Nadu Act 3 of 1984?
output: The Tamil Nadu Land Reforms (Fixation of Ceiling on Land) Amendment Act of 1983

instruction: What is the maximum penalty for an individual who trespasses on burial places with the intention of insulting religion or wounding religious feelings under section 297?
output: The maximum penalty can extend to one year of imprisonment, or with a fine, or with both.

instruction: What applies to a declaration made by the Court?
output: The provisions of sub-sections (2) and (3) apply to a declaration made by the Court.

instruction: What does 'Any head of charge when the context requires' refer to in this Code?
output: 'Charge' includes this.

instruction: What should the State do with the principles laid down in Part IV of the Constitution when making laws?
output: It shall be the duty of the State to apply these principles in making laws.

instruction: If A fires a pistol at Y, neither intending nor knowing himself to be likely to kill Z, who is near him, but out of sight, and ends up killing Z, has A committed murder or culpable homicide?
output: A has committed culpable homicide.

instruction: What occurs after the examination of the witnesses for the defence is complete?
output: The prosecutor shall sum up his case and the accused or his pleader shall be entitled to reply.

instruction: What is covered under state pensions, specifically those payable by the State or out of the Consolidated Fund of the State?
output: Entry 42 covers this.

instruction: What actions should be taken by the owner or the one in control of a tank, well, or excavation adjacent to the public way upon receiving an order?
output: The owner or the one in control is required to put up a sufficient fence as described in the order within a certain time frame, or they must appear in court to show cause why the order should not be enforced.

instruction: What is criminal trespass?
output: This is outlined in law 441.

instruction: What is the central act, numbered 52 of 1974, known as?
output: The central act, numbered 52 of 1974, is known as The Prevention of Smuggling Activities Act.

instruction: Who can order for removal of nuisance according to section 133?
output: A District Magistrate, a Sub-divisional Magistrate or any other Executive Magistrate specially empowered in this behalf by the State Government.

instruction: Who can the Court of Session direct the property to be delivered to instead of making an order under sub-section (1)?
output: The Chief Judicial Magistrate

instruction: Who can appoint a Commission to investigate the conditions of backward classes?
output: The President

instruction: What is the body corporate name for the District Council of a specific district and the Regional Council of a specific region?
output: The body corporate name for the District Council of a specific district is 'the District Council of (name of district)' and for the Regional Council of a specific region, it is 'the Regional Council of (name of region)'.

instruction: How can a Vice-President be removed from his office?
output: A Vice-President may be removed from his office by a resolution of the Council of States passed by a majority of all the then members of the Council and agreed to by the House of the People. However, no resolution for this purpose shall be moved unless at least fourteen days' notice has been given.

instruction: What does a person need to be a citizen of and what judicial position must they have held for at least ten years to qualify for appointment as a Judge of a High Court?
output: A person needs to be a citizen of India and have held a judicial office in the territory for at least ten years to qualify for appointment as a Judge of a High Court.

instruction: What can someone be charged with under section 473 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: A person can be separately charged with, and convicted of, the possession of each seal.

instruction: What circumstances lead to a culpable homicide not being classified as murder?
output: Culpable homicide is not murder if the offender, whilst deprived of the power of self-control by grave and sudden provocation, causes the death of the person who gave the provocation or causes the death of any other person by mistake or accident.

instruction: What is the punishment for imputations, assertions prejudicial to national integration?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What does 'Indian State' mean in the context of the Constitution?
output: 'Indian State' refers to any territory recognised before the commencement of the Constitution by His Majesty or the Government of the Dominion of India as being such a State.

instruction: Which act talks about a person being compelled by threats?
output: Act 94

instruction: What does the term 'Panchayat' refer to in the constitution?
output: 'Panchayat' refers to an institution as specified in the constitution.

instruction: What does 243-ZS state about the application to Union territories?
output: 243-ZS states that the provisions of this Part apply to the Union territories. In their application to a Union territory without a Legislative Assembly, references to the Legislature of a State should be a reference to the administrator thereof appointed under Article 239. In relation to a Union territory having a Legislative Assembly, it is to that Legislative Assembly. However, the President may direct that the provisions of this Part shall not apply to any Union territory or Part thereof as specified in a notification in the Official Gazette.

instruction: Which rule discusses the power to take bond for appearance?
output: Rule 88 discusses the power to take bond for appearance.

instruction: What is the punishment for the eighth offense?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: Which section covers kidnapping?
output: Section 359

instruction: Where can an Indian citizen, who has committed a murder in Uganda, be tried and convicted of murder if they are found in India?
output: An Indian citizen who commits a murder in Uganda can be tried and convicted of murder in any place in India where they are found.

instruction: What does the Constitution say the Chairman or the Speaker of a House can do in the event of a wilful contravention by any person of the rules?
output: The Chairman or the Speaker of a House may, without prejudice to the provisions of article 105 or, as the case may be, article 194, and to any other power which he may have under this Constitution direct that the contravention may be dealt with in the same manner as a breach of privilege of the House.

instruction: What happens to an Ordinance laid before the Legislature of the Union territory according to clause 1 of article 239A, and when does it cease to operate?
output: The Ordinance shall cease to operate at the expiration of six weeks from the reassembly of the Legislature or if, before the expiration of that period, a resolution disapproving it is passed by the Legislature, upon the passing of the resolution. It may also be withdrawn at any time by the administrator after obtaining instructions from the President.

instruction: What is FORM NO. 24?
output: Magistrate’s order to prevent obstruction, riot, etc.

instruction: What can the presiding officer of a court do if a person who is bound by a bond to appear before the court does not show up?
output: The officer presiding in such Court may issue a warrant directing that such person be arrested and produced before him.

instruction: What does Explanation 2 state about causing death by bodily injury?
output: Explanation 2 states that the person who causes such bodily injury shall be deemed to have caused the death, even if the death might have been prevented by proper remedies and skilful treatment.

instruction: Can the powers referred to in sub-section (2) be exercised by a Court of appeal, confirmation or revision?
output: Yes, the powers referred to in sub-section (2) can also be exercised by a Court of appeal, confirmation or revision while dealing with the case in which the order referred to in sub-section (1) was made.

instruction: Under which act was the Delhi Special Police Establishment constituted?
output: Under the Delhi Special Police Establishment Act, 1946.

instruction: Which Schedule includes programs such as family welfare, women and child development, social welfare, including welfare of the handicapped and mentally retarded, and welfare of the weaker sections, particularly of the Scheduled Castes?
output: These programs are included in the Eleventh Schedule.

instruction: What is the minimum proportion of the District Planning Committee's members that should be elected from the Panchayat and Municipalities?
output: Not less than four-fifths of the total number of members of the District Planning Committee shall be elected by, and from amongst, the elected members of the Panchayat at the district level and of the Municipalities in the district.

instruction: Who can be co-opted as members of the board?
output: The Legislature of a State shall, by law, make provisions for co-option of persons to be members of the board having experience in the field of banking, management, finance or specialisation in any other field relating to the objects and activities undertaken by the co-operative society.

instruction: What is the purpose of Form No. 36?
output: Form No. 36 is an order requiring production in court of a person in prison for answering to a charge of an offence.

instruction: What sentences can an Assistant Sessions Judge pass?
output: An Assistant Sessions Judge may pass any sentence authorised by law except a sentence of death or of imprisonment for life or of imprisonment for a term exceeding ten years.

instruction: What is the procedure for a Magistrate when it's not proved necessary for a person to execute a bond under section 116, especially if the person is in custody for the purposes of the inquiry or if the person is not in custody?
output: The Magistrate should make an entry on the record to that effect. If such person is in custody only for the purposes of the inquiry, the Magistrate shall release him. If such person is not in custody, the Magistrate shall discharge him.

instruction: What should the Magistrate do if it appears that any party has been forcibly and wrongfully dispossessed?
output: The text does not provide a complete answer to this question as it is cut off.

instruction: Which section of offences carries a punishment of rigorous imprisonment not less than 1 year but which may extend to 3 years and fine?
output: Section 509A and 509B

instruction: What does the court do when an accused is sentenced to imprisonment but is not present in court?
output: The court will issue a warrant for his arrest and the sentence commences from the date of his arrest.

instruction: What is the procedure for the President to follow regarding the recommendations made by the Finance Commission under the provisions of the Constitution?
output: The President shall cause every recommendation made by the Finance Commission under the provisions of this Constitution together with an explanatory memorandum as to the action taken thereon to be laid before each House of Parliament.

instruction: Who has the power to confer powers under this code?
output: The High Court or the State Government

instruction: What can the Magistrate do if he deems property is subject to speedy and natural decay?
output: He may make an order for the proper custody or sale of such property, and, upon the completion of the inquiry, shall make such order for the disposal of such property, or the sale-proceeds thereof, as he thinks fit.

instruction: What can A be charged and convicted of in the last case?
output: Intentionally giving false evidence

instruction: What is the term 'in any local area' substituted for, in the application to the State of Himachal Pradesh?
output: 'in any district'

instruction: What is the minimum percentage of seats reserved for women in every Panchayat?
output: One-third of the total number of seats are reserved for women in every Panchayat.

instruction: Which section mentions that there should be no unnecessary restraint?
output: Section 49 mentions that there should be no unnecessary restraint.

instruction: Who can the person, who finds further detention unnecessary, order to be forwarded to a Magistrate?
output: The accused

instruction: What is a term for anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or of property?
output: The term for anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or of property is 'vessel'.

instruction: Which section deals with the warrant for levy of fine?
output: Section 421

instruction: What is a Metropolitan Magistrate's judgment?
output: Section 355 pertains to Metropolitan Magistrate's judgment.

instruction: Under what circumstances can a Court in India order the attachment or forfeiture of property?
output: If the Court in India has reasonable grounds to believe that any property obtained by any person is derived or obtained, directly or indirectly, by such person from the commission of an offence

instruction: When does the right of private defence of property against criminal trespass or mischief continue?
output: The right of private defence of property against criminal trespass or mischief continues as long as the offender continues in the commission of criminal trespass or mischief.

instruction: What can the Governor do if an act or resolution of a District or Regional Council is likely to endanger the safety of India or is prejudicial to public order?
output: The Governor may annul or suspend such act or resolution and take such steps as he may consider necessary, including the suspension of the Council and the assumption to himself of all or any of the powers vested in or exercisable by the Council.

instruction: What happens if an elected member of a House joins a political party after being elected independently?
output: The member will be disqualified for being a member of the House if he joins any political party after such election.

instruction: What rights does article 235 of the Constitution not take away from a person belonging to the judicial service of a State?
output: Any right of appeal which he may have under the law regulating the conditions of his service

instruction: What conditions must be met before an accused person is paid compensation?
output: The compensation shall not be paid to him before the period allowed for the presentation of the appeal has elapsed, or, if an appeal is presented, before the appeal has been decided.

instruction: What can a person be convicted of if only some particulars of a combined offence are proved?
output: The person can be convicted of the complete minor offense

instruction: What happens to the liability of a surety's estate in respect of a bond if the surety dies before the bond is forfeited?
output: His estate shall be discharged from all liability in respect of the bond.

instruction: What are the exceptions in sections 87, 88 and 89 not extended to?
output: The exceptions in sections 87, 88 and 89 do not extend to acts which are offences independently of any harm.

instruction: What are the types of punishments stipulated in the Indian Penal Code?
output: The types of punishments are mentioned in Chapter III of the Indian Penal Code, but the actual details are not provided in the given text.

instruction: What form of numerals is to be used for the official purposes of the Union?
