instruction: Who can direct the officers in command of the armed forces to arrest and confine the persons forming part of the assembly?
output: The Executive Magistrate can direct the officers in command of the armed forces to arrest and confine such persons forming part of the assembly.

instruction: What can The District Magistrate, Chief Judicial Magistrate, Court of Session or High Court require from the postal or telegraph authority during an investigation or trial?
output: They can require the postal or telegraph authority to deliver a document, parcel, or thing.

instruction: What is the punishment for someone who voluntarily causes grievous hurt to extort property, or to constrain to an illegal act?
output: Punishment with imprisonment for life, or imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and also liable to fine.

instruction: Who tries the cases made over to the Additional and Assistant Sessions Judges?
output: The Sessions Judge of the division or the High Court

instruction: What kind of offense is outlined in Section 300?
output: Murder

instruction: Who is responsible if an animal causes damage?
output: The owner of the animal.

instruction: What happens to every member, whether elected or nominated, of an existing Regional Council?
output: They shall be deemed to have been elected or, as the case may be, nominated to the corresponding new District Council and shall hold office until a District Council is duly constituted for the corresponding new district under this Schedule.

instruction: Under which section of the Indian Penal Code is an offence punishable if the persons are in a marital relationship?
output: Section 376B of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)

instruction: What does defamation look like when it involves allegations of stealing someone's watch?
output: Defamation in this context can be represented in different ways. For instance, if someone says 'Z is an honest man; he never stole B's watch', with the intention to cause it to be believed that Z did steal B's watch, this is defamation. Another example is when asked who stole B's watch, and someone points to Z, intending to cause it to be believed that Z stole B's watch. A third example is when someone draws a picture of Z running away with B's watch, intending it to be believed that Z stole B's watch.

instruction: What should be done when an order cannot be served in the usual manner?
output: When an order cannot be served in the normal way, it should be notified by.

instruction: Which section of law defines the crime of 'Disclosure of identity of the victim of certain offences, etc.'?
output: Section 228A

instruction: Which article relates to the reservation of seats for the Scheduled Castes?
output: Article 243D

instruction: Under what conditions can an order for the detention of the accused in a lunatic asylum be made?
output: An order for the detention of the accused in a lunatic asylum can be made under clause (a) of sub-section (1) only in accordance with such rules as the State Government may have made under the Indian Lunacy Act, 1912.

instruction: What does Act 91 specifically exclude?
output: Act 91 excludes acts which are offences independently of harm caused.

instruction: Who can an Executive Magistrate or police officer require assistance from when dispersing an assembly?
output: They may require the assistance of any male person, not being an officer or member of the armed forces and acting as such.

instruction: What are some offences under this section related to obscene objects according to the law?
output: Selling, letting to hire, distributing, publicly exhibiting, or any manner of putting into circulation any obscene object, as well as importing, exporting, or conveying any obscene object for the mentioned purposes, or taking part in or receiving profits from any business in the course of which obscene objects are made, produced, kept, imported, exported, conveyed, publicly exhibited or in any manner put into circulation, or advertising or making known that any person is engaged or is ready to engage in any act which is an offence under this section, or offering or attempting to do any act which is an offence under this section.

instruction: What is the offense committed by a public servant who voluntarily allows a State prisoner or prisoner of war to escape?
output: The public servant has committed the offense of voluntarily allowing a prisoner of state or war to escape.

instruction: What can the President do if any difficulty arises in giving effect to any of the foregoing provisions of this article?
output: The President may, by order, do anything which appears to him to be necessary for the purpose of removing that difficulty.

instruction: What is the minimum number of Ministers in a State?
output: The number of Ministers, including the Chief Minister in a State shall not be less than twelve

instruction: What should the proceedings be under section 109 or section 110 according to the text?
output: The proceedings under section 109 or section 110 should be rigorous or simple as the Court or Magistrate in each case directs.

instruction: Can the report of such person be used as evidence in a case?
output: Yes, the report of a person can be read as evidence in the case.

instruction: What does 'Unit' include in this section?
output: A regiment, corps, ship, detachment, group, battalion or Company.

instruction: What are the changes made to paragraph (b) and Explanation II of the proviso to sub-section (2) of section 167 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, under Orissa amendment?
output: For paragraph (b), the following paragraph shall be substituted: '(b) no Magistrate shall authorize detention of the accused in custody of the police under this section unless the accused in produced before him in person for the first time and subsequently every time till the accused remains in the custody of the police, but the Magistrate may extend further detention in Judicial custody on production of the accused either in person or through the medium of electronic video linkage'. For Explanation II, the following Explanation shall be substituted: 'Explanation II— If any question arises whether an accused person was produced before the Magistrate as required under paragraph (b), the production of the accused person may be proved by his signature on the order authorizing detention'

instruction: What happens until the taking effect, under article 170, of the re-adjustment, on the basis of the first census after the year 2026?
output: The seats which shall be reserved for the Scheduled Tribes in the Legislative Assemblies of the States of Arunachal Pradesh, Meghalaya, Mizoram and Nagaland

instruction: Who is responsible for ascertaining and certifying the net proceeds of any tax or duty, or of any part of any tax or duty, in or attributable to any area?
output: The Comptroller and Auditor-General of India.

instruction: When should the court make an order to restore possession of immovable property after a conviction?
output: The court should make the order no more than one month after the date of the conviction.

instruction: What is mentioned in section 276?
output: Section 276 discusses the Record in trial before Court of Session.

instruction: Are Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Lakshadweep mentioned in the text as union territories?
output: Yes

instruction: What powers does the Bodoland Territorial Council have in terms of animal husbandry and veterinary?
output: The Bodoland Territorial Council has the power to make laws on preservation, protection and improvement of stock and prevention of animal diseases, veterinary training and practice, and cattle pounds.

instruction: What position is capable of holding an inquiry or trial according to the general or special order?
output: Judicial Magistrate

instruction: What should be noted in the report related to examination?
output: The exact time of commencement and completion of the examination should be noted in the report.

instruction: What qualifications or experiences are required for a person to be given the powers of a Metropolitan Magistrate by the High Court?
output: The person must possess such qualification or experience in relation to legal affairs as the High Court may, by rules, specify.

instruction: What does it mean when a court visits and inspects a place where an offense is alleged to have been committed, records a memorandum of relevant facts observed, summons any person as a witness, examines any person in attendance even if not summoned as a witness, or recalls and re-examines any person already examined?
output: These are actions a court can take during an inquiry, trial or other proceeding.

instruction: What is section 113 about?
output: Summons or warrant in case of person not so present.

instruction: What is the consequence for issuing or signing a false certificate?
output: The person shall be punished in the same manner as if he gave false evidence.

instruction: Who has the power to make laws?
output: The District Councils and Regional Councils

instruction: Who is mentioned as the victim in section 422 regarding fraudulently preventing?
output: Ditto.

instruction: What does act 100 describe?
output: Act 100 describes when the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death.

instruction: What is considered an offence if a person voluntarily causes or attempts to cause any person to do anything which that person is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do anything which he is legally entitled to do, by inducing or attempting to induce that person to believe that he or any person in whom he is interested will become or will be rendered by some act of the offender an object of Divine displeasure?
output: This is considered an offence as per Act 508.

instruction: What should be stated in the judgment when a sentence is awarded for a term of years?
output: The reasons for the sentence awarded should be stated in the judgment.

instruction: What does the State Government establish for every sessions division?
output: A Court of Session

instruction: How are the votes of each elected member of the Legislative Assembly of a State calculated?
output: The votes of each elected member of the Legislative Assembly of a State are calculated as many times as there are multiples of one thousand in the quotient obtained by dividing the population of the State by the total number of the elected members of the Assembly.

instruction: What does Article 243ZG state about the validity of laws relating to delimitation of constituencies and the questioning of elections in any municipality?
output: Article 243ZG states that the validity of any law relating to the delimitation of constituencies or the allotment of seats to such constituencies, made or purporting to be made under article 243ZA shall not be called in question in any court. Also, no election to any Municipality shall be called in question except by an election petition presented to such authority and in such manner as is provided for by or under any law made by the Legislature of a State.

instruction: What is the punishment for having possession of any instrument or material intended for counterfeiting government stamps?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and also liable to fine.

instruction: What does the Court do if the accused is not present when he is sentenced to imprisonment, and when does his sentence commence?
output: The Court shall issue a warrant for his arrest for the purpose of forwarding him to the jail or other place in which he is to be confined; the sentence shall commence on the date of his arrest.

instruction: What does the constitution say about citizenship, naturalisation and aliens?
output: Not specified in the provided text.

instruction: Which territories, immediately before the commencement of the Constitution (Thirty-sixth Amendment) Act 1975, were included in Sikkim?
output: The territories which were included in Sikkim before the commencement of the Constitution (Thirty-sixth Amendment) Act, 1975 are the same territories that were comprised in Sikkim.

instruction: What is the punishment for participating in activities likely to cause fear or alarm among any religious, racial, language or regional group or caste or community?
output: The punishment can extend to three years of imprisonment, or a fine, or both.

instruction: What is the definition of 'board' in the context of co-operative societies?
output: A 'board' refers to the board of directors or the governing body of a co-operative society, by whatever name called, to which the direction and control of the management of the affairs of a society is entrusted to.

instruction: What is the maximum term of imprisonment and fine for a crime that includes preventing service of summons or other proceeding, or preventing publication thereof?
output: The maximum term of imprisonment may extend to one month and the fine may extend to five hundred rupees.

instruction: What Act is also known as The Uttar Pradesh Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950?
output: Uttar Pradesh Act I of 1951

instruction: What is the role of any Magistrate in cases mentioned in sub-section (1) of section 174?
output: Any Magistrate so empowered may hold an inquiry into the cause of death either instead of, or in addition to, the investigation held by the police.

instruction: According to section 3, what powers can the High Court confer on any member of the Judicial Service of the State, functioning as a Judge in a Civil Court?
output: The High Court may confer the powers of a Judicial Magistrate of the first class or of the second class.

instruction: What is the effect of releasing the accused?
output: Such release shall have the effect of discharge.

instruction: What is the penalty for a person omitting to take order with any animal in his possession, so as to guard against danger to human life, or of grievous hurt, from such animal under code 289?
output: Imprisonment for 6 months, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

instruction: What does rigorous imprisonment for a term not less than ten years, which may extend to life imprisonment, and a fine pertain to?
output: This punishment pertains to trafficking more than one person.

instruction: What is the provision related to the creation of a body under article 239A for the Union territory of Puducherry?
output: When any body is created under article 239A to function as a Legislature for the Union territory of Puducherry, the President shall not make any regulation for the peace, progress and good government of that Union territory with effect from the date appointed for the first meeting of the Legislature.

instruction: What happens if the Magistrate finds no evidence supporting the denial of the existence of a public right?
output: If the Magistrate finds that there is no such evidence, he shall proceed as laid down in section 138.

instruction: What role is held by the individual who is allowed to take all steps necessary for tracing and identifying property as per the text?
output: An officer below the rank of Sub-Inspector of Police

instruction: Who does the Prosecution consist of?
output: The Prosecution consists of a Director of Prosecution and as many Deputy Directors of Prosecution as it thinks fit.

instruction: What is the condition under which something is done or believed in 'good faith'?
output: Something is done or believed in 'good faith' when it is done or believed with due care and attention.

instruction: Under what conditions will grave and sudden provocation not mitigate the punishment for an assault offence?
output: Grave and sudden provocation will not mitigate the punishment if the provocation is sought or voluntarily provoked by the offender as an excuse for the offence, or if the provocation is given by anything done in obedience to the law, or by a public servant in the lawful exercise of the powers of such public servant, or if the provocation is given by anything done in the lawful exercise of the right of private defence.

instruction: What can a Magistrate do if there is sufficient ground for proceeding with a warrant-case?
output: The Magistrate may issue a warrant, or, if he thinks fit, a summons, for causing the accused to be brought or to appear at a certain time before such Magistrate or some other Magistrate having jurisdiction.

instruction: Who holds all the powers of an officer in charge of a police station in relation to an offence?
output: The instructed officer does.

instruction: Who is a person against whom an offence falling under Chapter XXI of the Indian Penal Code can be committed?
output: An offence can be committed against a person who, at the time of such commission, is the President of India, the Vice-President of India, the Governor of a State, the Administrator of a Union territory or a Minister of the Union or of a State or of a Union territory, or any other public servant employed in connection with the affairs of the Union or of a State.

instruction: What can the Court of appeal, confirmation or revision do if they believe a failure of justice has been occasioned due to an error, omission or irregularity in the charge?
output: It can direct a new trial to be had upon a charge framed in whatever manner it thinks fit.

instruction: What happens if someone is found with materials for the purpose of counterfeiting government stamps?
output: They shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: Who authorizes a Municipality to levy, collect and appropriate taxes, duties, tolls, and fees, and under what conditions?
output: The Legislature of a State authorises a Municipality to levy, collect and appropriate such taxes, duties, tolls and fees in accordance with such procedure and subject to such limits.

instruction: Which territories were immediately before the commencement of this Constitution were comprised in the Province of Assam, the Khasi States, and the Assam Tribal Areas, but excluding the territories specified in the Schedule to the Assam (Alteration of Boundaries) Act, 1951 and the territories specified in sub-section (1) of section 3 of the State of Nagaland Act, 1962 and the territories specified in sections 5, 6 and 7 of the North-Eastern Areas (Reorganisation) Act, 1971 and the territories referred to in Part I of the Second Schedule to the Constitution (One Hundredth Amendment) Act, 2015, notwithstanding anything contained in clause (a) of section 3 of the Constitution (Ninth Amendment) Act, 1960, so far as it relates to the territories referred to in Part I of the Second Schedule to the Constitution (One Hundredth Amendment) Act, 2015?
output: These are the territories of Assam according to the First Schedule.

instruction: What does 243-ZR state about the application of provisions to multi-State co-operative societies?
output: 243-ZR states that the provisions of this Part apply to the multi-State co-operative societies, with the modification that any reference to 'Legislature of a State', 'State Act' or 'State Government' should be construed as a reference to 'Parliament', 'Central Act' or 'the Central Government' respectively.

instruction: What actions are included in the definition of house-breaking?
output: House-breaking includes when a person enters or quits a house by using criminal force, committing an assault, threatening any person with assault, or by opening any lock in order to commit the trespass. It also includes entering or quitting by any passage known to have been fastened against such entrance or departure and unfastened by the trespasser or an abettor.

instruction: What is the definition of a 'bailable offence' in this Code?
output: An offence which is shown as bailable in the First Schedule, or which is made bailable by any other law for the time being in force.

instruction: What is considered a statement in lieu of examination-in-chief according to the Indian Evidence Act, 1872?
output: A statement recorded of a person, who is temporarily or permanently mentally or physically disabled, is considered a statement in lieu of examination-in-chief.

instruction: How long is the duration from the date a public notice or order is issued or made until it can no longer remain in force?
output: Three months

instruction: What is the effect of a Proclamation of Emergency according to the Constitution of India?
output: While a Proclamation of Emergency is in operation, the executive power of the Union extends to giving directions to any State as to the manner in which the executive power thereof is to be exercised. The power of Parliament to make laws with respect to any matter includes power to make laws conferring powers and imposing duties upon the Union or officers and authorities of the Union as respects that matter.

instruction: What is the chapter 265A about?
output: Chapter 265A is about plea bargaining.

instruction: Under which sections of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860) can A be charged and convicted if he dishonestly uses a forged document as genuine evidence to convict B, a public servant?
output: A can be separately charged with, and convicted of, offences under sections 471 (read with section 466) and 196.

instruction: Who can compound an offence under this section if the competent person is deceased?
output: The legal representative, as defined in the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908 of such person may compound the offence.

instruction: What type of offence is the continuance of nuisance after injunction to discontinue under section 291?
output: Cognizable

instruction: Which point of List III is about the transfer of property other than agricultural land; registration of deeds and documents?
output: It is point 6 of List III.

instruction: What does the Magistrate do if he finds the accused not guilty?
output: If the Magistrate finds the accused not guilty, he shall record an order of acquittal.

instruction: Who has jurisdiction over the offence of personation of a juror or assessor, according to the provisions of Chapter XXVI?
output: Any Magistrate

instruction: Is it necessary to have the recommendation of the President to make a demand for a grant?
output: Yes

instruction: What is highlighted in Section 412?
output: Reasons to be recorded.

instruction: What allowances is a person entitled to when requested to act as a High Court Judge according to this text?
output: The person is entitled to such allowances as the President may by order determine.

instruction: Who, according to the Indian Penal Code, has the authority to make a general or special order with the previous sanction of the State Government to communicate information regarding any matter likely to affect the maintenance of order or the prevention of crime or the safety of person or property?
output: The District Magistrate

instruction: Under what circumstances is personal attendance not required to hear the judgment pronounced by the Court?
output: Personal attendance is not always required, especially if the individual's personal attendance during the trial has been dispensed with and the sentence is one of fine only or if the individual is acquitted.

instruction: What does section 351 deal with?
output: Section 351 deals with appeals from convictions under sections 344, 345, 349 and 350.

instruction: What is the minimum age requirement for a seat in the Council of States and the House of the People in the Indian Parliament?
output: The minimum age requirement for a seat in the Council of States is thirty years, and for a seat in the House of the People is twenty-five years.

instruction: What happens if someone falsely informs the Magistrate about a dacoity in order to mislead them and facilitate the commission of the offence?
output: The person is punishable under the law which allows for imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or if the offence is not committed, with imprisonment of either description, for a term which may extend to three years; and in either case shall also be liable to fine.

instruction: What is the term for such tribes or tribal communities or parts of or groups within such tribes or tribal communities?
output: The term for such tribes or tribal communities or parts of or groups within such tribes or tribal communities is 'Scheduled Tribes'.

instruction: If a person intentionally co-operates in the commission of an offence by doing any one of multiple acts that constitute the offence, what offence would they be committing?
output: The same offence

instruction: What is the Kerala Act 29 of 1974?
output: The Kerala Cashew Factories (Acquisition) Act

instruction: What is the maximum sentence of imprisonment or fine that a High Court can pass with no possibility of appeal, according to section 376?
output: The maximum sentence is imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or a fine not exceeding one thousand rupees, or both.

instruction: Which section includes the punishment for bribery?
output: Section 171E

instruction: Who should be consulted before making a regulation under this paragraph if there is a Tribes Advisory Council for the State?
output: The Tribes Advisory Council

instruction: Where is a person confined when they are removed to a criminal jail under sub-section (2) of section 417?
output: The person is confined in the criminal jail.

instruction: What does clause (1) of article 145 in the Constitution of India include?
output: It includes rules pertaining to persons practising before the Court, procedure for hearing appeals, proceedings for enforcement of rights, proceedings under article 139A, entertainment of appeals under sub-clause (c) of clause (1) of article 134, conditions for review of judgment or order, costs of proceedings, granting of bail, stay of proceedings, summary determination of appeals, and procedure for inquiries referred to in clause (1) of article 317.

instruction: What is the term of office for a person elected to fill a casual vacancy in the office of Vice-President?
output: The person elected to fill a casual vacancy in the office of Vice-President is entitled to hold office for the full term of five years from the date on which he enters upon his office.

instruction: What does Form No. 54 authorize?
output: Form No. 54 authorizes the imprisonment of an individual who has breached a bond to keep the peace and failed to pay the forfeited sum, despite being called upon to do so.

instruction: Who is the intended recipient of the search suspected place of deposit order?
output: A police officer above the rank of a constable.

instruction: Through what medium can the Magistrate certify the order of production of the accused person according to Orissa Act 16 of 2009?
output: The Magistrate can certify the order through the medium of electronic video linkage.

instruction: Which section focuses on 'Imprisonment in default of security'?
output: Section 122

instruction: What is the consequence under sub-section (1) or under sub-section (2) when an application for the grant of special leave to appeal from an order of acquittal is rejected?
output: No appeal from that order of acquittal shall lie.

instruction: What does the Notification of substance of warrant correspond to?
output: Section 75

instruction: What is the punishment for abetment if the person abetted does the act with a different intention or knowledge from that of the abettor?
output: The abettor will be punished with the punishment provided for the offence which would have been committed if the act had been done with the intention or knowledge of the abettor.

instruction: What does Section 156 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, grant a police officer the power to do?
output: Section 156 grants a police officer the power to investigate a cognizable case without the order of a Magistrate.

instruction: Are the crimes mentioned cognizable or not?
output: Yes, they are cognizable.

instruction: What is considered forgery according to the first example?
output: A signing his own name to a bill of exchange, intending that it may be believed that the bill was drawn by another person of the same name.

instruction: Can the President direct the Governor to return the law to the Bodoand Territorial Council?
output: Yes, the President may direct the Governor to return the law to the Bodoland Territorial Council, along with a message requesting reconsideration or amendments.

instruction: What powers can an Administrator or Executive Magistrate exercise in respect of an appeal?
output: They may exercise all or any of the powers of the proper Appellate Court and sub-section (1) of section 389 with regard to suspension of sentence or release of a convicted person on bail.

instruction: What is the punishment for intentionally insulting or interrupting a public servant during a judicial proceeding?
output: The punishment is simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees.

instruction: What are the possible penalties for a person under sentence of death by a Court of Justice?
output: Imprisonment for life, or imprisonment for 14 years, with or without fine.

instruction: What can the Regional Council for an autonomous region and the District Council for an autonomous district do on lands and buildings, and on persons resident within such areas?
output: They have power to levy and collect taxes on lands and buildings, and tolls on persons resident within such areas.

instruction: What does article 484 discuss?
output: Repeal and savings.

instruction: What does the Interpretation of evidence to accused or his pleader refer to in legal terms?
output: In legal terms, the Interpretation of evidence to accused or his pleader refers to section 279.

instruction: What is the punishment for assaulting a superior officer in the Navy or Air Force of the Government of India?
output: The punishment for assaulting a superior officer in the Navy or Air Force of the Government of India is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and a fine.

instruction: When can the police diaries be used by the police officer who made them or by the court?
output: The police diaries can be used by the police officer who made them to refresh his memory, or if the Court uses them for the purpose of contradicting.

instruction: Is it essential for the offender to know that the act is likely to cause death?
output: No, it is not essential to this offence that the offender should know that the act is likely to cause death.

instruction: What crime is punishable by imprisonment for 10 years and a fine?
output: The crime of 'concealing with intent to facilitate a design to wage war'

instruction: What is the maximum term of imprisonment for house-trespass intending to commit theft?
output: The maximum term of imprisonment for house-trespass intending to commit theft can extend up to seven years.

instruction: What is the punishment for engaging in unlawful compulsory labour?
output: Imprisonment for 1 year, or fine, or both.

instruction: What is the role of the nearest Magistrate in cases referred to in clause (i) or clause (ii) of sub-section (3) of section 174?
output: The nearest Magistrate empowered to hold inquests shall hold an inquiry into the cause of death either instead of, or in addition to, the investigation held by the police.

instruction: What is Form No. 5 used for?
output: Form No. 5 is used to issue a proclamation requiring the attendance of a witness who is needed to be examined about a complaint.

instruction: Who is responsible for determining the compensatory allowance of a Chief Justice when not determined by law?
output: The President

instruction: What does it mean when someone voluntarily obstructs any person so as to prevent that person from proceeding in any direction in which that person has a right to proceed?
output: This is referred to as wrongful restraint.

instruction: What is the time period for the sanctioning authority to take a decision on the proposal for sanction?
output: Ninety days from the date of the receipt of the proposal for sanction.

instruction: Who has the authority to establish a common High Court for two or more States or Union territories?
output: Parliament

instruction: What does section 241 deal with?
output: Section 241 deals with conviction on plea of guilty.

instruction: Who signs the memorandum at the end of the confession record?
output: The memorandum at the end of the confession record is signed by the Magistrate.

instruction: What should be included in an application for plea bargaining and what should accompany it?
output: The application for plea bargaining should contain a brief description of the case relating to which the application is filed including the offence to which the case relates and should be accompanied by an affidavit sworn by the accused.

instruction: What is the punishment for being a thug?
output: The punishment for being a thug is imprisonment for life, and also being liable to fine.

instruction: What is the punishment for wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement a kidnapped or abducted person?
output: The text does not provide specific punishment details for this crime.

instruction: What are the ways a person who has been arrested by a police officer can be discharged?
output: On his own bond, or on bail, or under the special order of a Magistrate

instruction: What is the punishment for abetment of an assault by an officer, soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer, when in the execution of his office?
output: Imprisonment for 3 years and fine.

instruction: What are the consequences if someone assists in the concealment or disposal of stolen property, knowing it to be stolen?
output: Imprisonment for years and fine.

instruction: Who does the District Magistrate consult with to prepare a panel of names for the appointment of Public Prosecutors or Additional Public Prosecutors?
output: The Sessions Judge

instruction: What action may a court take after hearing a case?
output: The court may pass sentence.

instruction: What is the imprisonment duration and fine amount for an agent of owner or occupier for whose benefit a riot is committed not using all lawful means?
output: Imprisonment for 6 months and a fine of 2,000 rupees.

instruction: Who needs to request for a retired Judge to attend sittings of the Supreme Court, and whose consent is required?
output: The National Judicial Appointments Commission needs to request for a retired Judge to attend sittings of the Supreme Court, with the previous consent of the President.

instruction: What are the consequences if a public servant facilitates the commission of an offence?
output: The public servant may be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the longest term of such imprisonment, or with such fine as is provided for that offence, or with both.

instruction: What actions can a Sessions Judge take when he believes further investigation into an offence is necessary, particularly regarding bail and other matters?
output: The Sessions Judge may vacate the order made under sub-section (5) and direct further investigation to be made into the offence subject to such directions with regard to bail and other matters as he may specify.

instruction: Who is not prevented from taking security under section 71 by this section?
output: A police officer is not prevented by this section.

instruction: Who are the members of the National Judicial Appointments Commission?
output: The members of the National Judicial Appointments Commission are the Chief Justice of India, two other senior Judges of the Supreme Court next to the Chief Justice of India, the Union Minister in charge of Law and Justice, and two eminent persons nominated by the committee consisting of the Prime Minister, the Chief Justice of India and the Leader of Opposition in the House of the People.

instruction: What type of proceeding is a trial before a Court-martial according to Explanation 1?
output: A trial before a Court-martial is considered a judicial proceeding.

instruction: What is the official designation of the West Bengal Land Reforms (Amendment) Act, 1972?
output: The official designation of the West Bengal Land Reforms (Amendment) Act, 1972 is West Bengal Act XII of 1972.

instruction: What happens in section 111?
output: Order to be made.

instruction: What does the act where a person who is legally obligated to provide certain information or notice to a public servant fails to do so refer to?
output: It refers to 'Omission to give notice or information to public servant by person legally bound to give it'.

instruction: Who can seize items forfeited to the Government in India?
output: Any police officer

instruction: Under which sections of the Indian Penal Code can someone be charged if they wrongfully strike someone else with a cane?
output: They can be charged under sections 352 and 323 of the Indian Penal Code

instruction: What happens if a member of either House of Parliament or of a House of the Legislature is appointed Governor?
output: He shall be deemed to have vacated his seat in that House on the date on which he enters upon his office as Governor.

instruction: Who is entitled to the same emoluments, allowances, and privileges as the President or the Governor?
output: A person who discharges the functions of the Governor is entitled to the same emoluments, allowances, and privileges as the President or the Governor.

instruction: What does section 11 of the Customs Act, 1962 cover?
output: The text does not provide specific details on what section 11 of the Customs Act, 1962 covers.

instruction: What happens if money has been taken out of the possession of the convicted person upon his arrest?
output: The court may order that out of such money a sum not exceeding the price paid by the innocent purchaser be delivered to him, provided the stolen property is returned to its rightful owner.

instruction: Who has the power to assess and collect revenue in respect of lands within an autonomous region or district?
output: The Regional Council for an autonomous region and the District Council for an autonomous district have the power to assess and collect revenue in respect of lands within such region or district.

instruction: Who has the authority to detain a person in safe custody?
output: The Magistrate or Court has the authority to detain a person in safe custody.

instruction: What kind of cases can a Magistrate of the first class adjudicate?
output: Cases of criminal breach of trust.

instruction: What can the appropriate Government do if the conditions of a suspended or remitted sentence are not fulfilled?
output: The appropriate Government may cancel the suspension or remission, and the person in whose favour the sentence has been suspended or remitted may, if at large, be arrested by any police officer, without warrant and remanded to undergo the unexpired portion of the sentence.

instruction: What does a court require to take cognizance of an offence carried out by an official in the discharge of his duty, according to the Lokpal and Lokayuktas Act, 2013?
output: The court requires the previous sanction except as provided in the Act.

instruction: Which legal section mandates that a person arrested must be brought before Court without delay?
output: Section 76

instruction: In which cases does the 'appropriate Government' refer to the Central Government according to sections fifty-four and fifty-five?
output: The 'appropriate Government' refers to the Central Government in cases where the sentence is a sentence of death or is for an offence against any law relating to a matter to which the executive power of the Union extends.

instruction: Which section of the Indian Penal Code covers the offense of inducing the President of India or the Governor of a state to refrain from exercising a lawful power by assault?
output: Section 124

instruction: Which section talks about the making over or withdrawal of cases by Executive Magistrates?
output: Section 411

instruction: Which section of the law covers the act of collecting arms, etc., with the intention of waging war against the Government of India?
output: The act of collecting arms, etc., with the intention of waging war against the Government of India is covered in Section 122.

instruction: What can a person be required to do by the officer presiding in court, specifically in terms of bonds for court appearance?
output: The officer presiding in court can require a person to execute a bond, with or without sureties, for his appearance in such court, or any other court to which the case may be transferred for trial.

instruction: Who is entitled to receive as special pay an amount equivalent to the difference between the salary so specified and the salary which he was drawing as Auditor-General of India immediately before the commencement of the Constitution?
output: The person who was holding office immediately before the commencement of this Constitution as Auditor-General of India and has become on such commencement the Comptroller and Auditor-General of India under article 377 is entitled to this additional pay.

instruction: What is the legal code associated with the tender of pardon to an accomplice?
Which subsection did Section 505 become as a result of Act 35 of 1969, s. 3?
output: Section 505 was re-numbered as sub-section (1) of that section by Act 35 of 1969, s. 3.

instruction: Who are the ones entitled to receive salaries and allowances as determined by the Legislature of the State by law?
output: Members of the Legislative Assembly and the Legislative Council of a State are entitled to receive such salaries and allowances.

instruction: What is the provision for offences under section 379 of the Indian Penal Code?
output: An offence punishable under section 379 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860) shall be deemed to be an offence of the same kind as an offence punishable under section 380 of the said Code.

instruction: What is the possible penalty for a person who imports a girl under the age of twenty-one years from a foreign country with the intent of forcing her to illicit intercourse?
output: The penalty can extend to ten years of imprisonment along with a fine.

instruction: Who can a Magistrate authorise for further detention under section (b) and how should they be presented before the Magistrate?
output: The Magistrate can authorise further detention for the accused who is in the custody of police if they are produced in person before the Magistrate. If the accused is not in the custody of the police, they should be produced before the Magistrate either in person or through the medium of electronic video linkage, in accordance with the direction of the Magistrate.

instruction: What action can the Court of appeal, confirmation or revision take when they perceive a failure of justice due to an error, omission or irregularity in the charge?
output: They can direct a new trial to be had upon a charge framed in whatever manner they think fit.

instruction: What power does the Magistrate have regarding personal attendance?
output: The Magistrate may, if he sees sufficient cause, dispense with the personal attendance of any person called upon to show cause why he should not be ordered to execute a bond for keeping the peace or for good behaviour and may permit him to appear by a pleader.

instruction: How is a warrant for arrest of any person requiring him to attend or produce a document in a court in India, issued by a court in a contracting state, executed?
output: The warrant is executed as if it is the warrant received by the court in India from another court in India for execution within its local limits.

instruction: What occurs if the proceedings in respect of a person are commenced afresh, with witnesses re-heard, and the case proceeds as if such person was an accused person when the court took cognizance of the offence upon which the inquiry or trial was commenced?
output: The court would be proceeding against that person under sub-section (1).

instruction: What is the charge for A when he hands a knife to B, who is in a rage, and B kills Z?
output: Murder

instruction: Under what act or rules are the positions like Deputy Director of Prosecution filled in Karnataka?
output: The positions like Deputy Director of Prosecution in Karnataka are filled in accordance with the Cadre and Recruitment Rules framed under the Karnataka State Civil Services Act, 1978 (Karnataka Act 14 of 1990).

instruction: Is there sufficient information in the provided text to explain what happens when an award of imprisonment in default of payment of a fine is annexed to a substantive sentence?
output: No, the information is incomplete in the provided text.

instruction: What should be done when there are more Magistrates than one having jurisdiction and the acting Magistrate cannot decide who should handle the case?
output: The case should be reported for the orders of the High Court.

instruction: What does an inquiry, investigation or survey in respect of any person, place, property, assets, documents, books of account in any bank or public financial institutions or any other relevant matters pertain to?
output: These are the steps for tracing and identifying property.

instruction: What are the conditions under which this chapter applies?
output: The chapter applies if an offence appears to have been committed by the accused other than an offence for which the punishment of death or of imprisonment for life or of imprisonment for a term exceeding seven years has been provided under the law for the time being in force. It also applies if a Magistrate has taken cognizance of an offence on complaint, other than an offence for which the punishment of death or of imprisonment for life or of imprisonment for a term exceeding seven years, has been provided under the law for the time being in force, and after examining complainant and witnesses under section 200, issued the process under section 204.

instruction: What happens to the rights guaranteed by the article as per the Constitution?
output: The rights guaranteed by the article shall not be suspended except as otherwise provided for by the Constitution.

instruction: What is the punishment for dishonest misappropriation of movable property, or converting it to one’s own use?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What does the rules regarding the formation of subordinate local Councils or Boards, their procedure and the conduct of their business, and generally all matters relating to the transaction of business pertaining to the administration of the district or region pertain to?
output: These rules can be made by the District or the Regional Council

instruction: What changes were made by Act 63 of 1980, s. 5?
output: The Act substituted certain words and phrases, including 'reasons'.

instruction: According to the legislation, how many directors can a co-operative society have at maximum?
output: A co-operative society can have a maximum of twenty-one directors according to the legislation.

instruction: Who can issue a warrant for the execution of a sentence?
output: Every warrant for the execution of a sentence may be issued either by the Judge or Magistrate who passed the sentence, or by his successor-in-office.

instruction: What is the punishment for kidnapping?
output: Imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and also liable to fine

instruction: What is the penalty for a person who fails to pay the compensation they are due to pay?
output: The person by whom it is payable shall be sentenced to simple imprisonment for such term not exceeding thirty days as the Magistrate directs, unless such sum is sooner paid.

instruction: What is the Uttar Pradesh Act, numbered 18 of 1973?
output: The Uttar Pradesh Act, numbered 18 of 1973 is the Uttar Pradesh Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings (Amendment) Act, 1972.

instruction: Who determines the allowances and conditions for members of the Constituent Assembly of the Dominion of India if no provision is made, and what do they follow?
output: If no provision is made, the allowances and conditions for members of the Constituent Assembly of the Dominion of India are determined by Parliament through law, and they follow the rates and conditions that were applicable before the commencement of the Constitution.

instruction: What is the status of a document purporting to be a report under the hand of any officer of any Mint or of any Note Printing Press or of any Security Printing Press?
output: The document is considered as evidence.

instruction: What is required for a resolution to be passed by either House of Parliament?
output: For the purposes of clauses (4) and (5), a resolution may be passed by either House of Parliament only by a majority of the total membership of that House and by a majority of not less than two-thirds of the Members of that House present and voting.

instruction: What occurs if a Speaker or Deputy Speaker of the Assembly ceases to be a member?
output: He vacates his office.

instruction: What is the punishment for resisting or obstructing lawful apprehension of any person, or rescuing him from lawful custody?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine, or both.

instruction: What does the Constitution of India say about the validity and the possibility of questioning in court of laws that aim to secure the principles laid down in Part IV, especially in relation to article 14 and article 19?
output: The Constitution of India states that no law giving effect to the policy of the State towards securing any of the principles laid down in Part IV shall be deemed to be void on the ground that it is inconsistent with, or takes away or abridges any of the rights conferred by article 14 or article 19. It also adds that no law containing a declaration that it is for giving effect to such policy shall be called in question in any court on the ground that it does not give effect to such policy.

instruction: What should a judgment of acquittal state?
output: A judgment of acquittal should state the offence of which the accused is acquitted and direct that he be set at liberty

instruction: What does the Form No. 30 allow the accused to do?
output: Form No. 30 allows the accused to appear in person, to transmit a plea of guilty in writing and pay a fine, or to appear by pleader and plead guilty, authorising the pleader to make such a plea and pay the fine on their behalf.

instruction: What does the Code refer to as illegal omissions, except where a contrary intention appears from the context?
output: Words referring to acts

instruction: Where should the warrant be lodged if the prisoner is to be confined in a jail?
output: The warrant should be lodged with the jailor.

instruction: Does the amount apportioned to a State under clause (1) form part of the Consolidated Fund of India?
output: No, it does not form part of the Consolidated Fund of India.

instruction: What actions can a Governor take with regards to a particular Act of Parliament or of the Legislature of the State in a Scheduled Area, and what regulations can they make?
output: The Governor may direct that any particular Act of Parliament or of the Legislature of the State shall not apply to a Scheduled Area or any part thereof in the State or shall apply to a Scheduled Area or any part thereof in the State subject to exceptions and modifications as specified in the notification. The Governor can also make regulations for the peace and good government of any area in a State which is for the time being a Scheduled Area.

instruction: What is the condition, under which nothing is considered an offence, that involves a person believing in good faith due to a mistake of fact and not law that he is bound by law?
output: This condition is the general exception according to Article 76 in Chapter IV

instruction: What should happen if the accused is in custody when the judgment is pronounced?
output: The accused should be brought up to hear the judgment pronounced.

instruction: What happens to the accused who used force or violence at the time of committing an offence which is not compoundable?
output: The provision is that the accused is not charged with another offence.

instruction: Who cannot be ordered for an investigation under this section without previous sanction?
output: A person who is or was a public servant as defined under any other law for the time being in force.

instruction: What is the punishment for instigating a sect consisting of more than ten members to attack another sect?
output: The punishment can be imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What does it mean if any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters, figures or marks, or by more than one of those means, intended to be used, or which may be used, as evidence of that matter?
output: It denotes the term 'Document'

instruction: What does section 347 state about the Registrar or Sub-Registrar?
output: When the State Government so directs, any Registrar or any Sub-Registrar appointed under the 1*** Registration Act, 1908 (16 of 1908), shall be deemed to be a Civil Court within the meaning of sections 345 and 346.

instruction: What were applied to the Judges of the Federal Court that now governs the rights in respect of leave of absence and pension of the Judges of the Supreme Court?
output: The provisions which, immediately before the commencement of this Constitution

instruction: What is the The Hyderabad Jagirs Act?
output: The Hyderabad Jagirs Act, 1358F is an act listed in the Ninth Schedule of the Indian Constitution. It's a regional law specific to what was then the state of Hyderabad.

instruction: What must the officer do when required to issue a search warrant by an officer in charge of another station according to section 166?
output: Such officer, on being so required, shall proceed according to the provisions.
In these sections, the word 'offence' denotes a thing punishable.

instruction: What does it mean to impede or block a public servant from performing their official duties?
output: This refers to 'Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions'.

instruction: What is the code for secreting or destroying any document to prevent its production as evidence?
After which words, bracket and figure were the words, brackets, figure and letter “or sub-section (6-A)” inserted in sub-section (7)?
output: After the words, bracket and figure “sub-section (6)”

instruction: Who receives the audit reports of District and Regional Councils' accounts?
output: The Governor

instruction: What is the purpose of the victim compensation scheme according to Article 357A of the Constitution of India?
output: To provide funds for the purpose of compensation to the victim or his dependents who have suffered loss or injury as a result of the crime and who require rehabilitation

instruction: What action can the President take if a language spoken by a significant portion of a state's population wishes to have their language officially recognised?
output: The President may direct that such language shall also be officially recognised throughout that State or any part thereof for such purpose as he may specify.

instruction: What is the subject of Section 411?
output: Making over or withdrawal of cases by Executive Magistrates.

instruction: Who records the reasons in writing when an application is rejected wholly or in part, and how is it done?
output: If the application is rejected wholly or in part, the Magistrate or the State Government, as the case may be, shall record in writing the reasons for so doing.

instruction: What does Section 344 detail?
output: Section 344 details the summary procedure for trial for giving false evidence.

instruction: What is the consequence of 'attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment'?
output: The text does not specify the consequences of attempting to commit offences that are punishable with imprisonment.

instruction: What does section 220 pertain to?
output: Trial for more than one offence.

instruction: Is consent necessary for criminal conspiracy cases under the provisions of section 195?
output: No

instruction: What will be the result at the expiration of six consecutive months, if a Minister is not a member of either House of Parliament during that period?
output: The Minister shall cease to be a Minister.

instruction: Is it allowed to use the report of specified officers as evidence in any inquiry, trial or other proceeding under this Code?
output: Yes

instruction: What does section 47 discuss?
output: Section 47 discusses the search of a place entered by a person sought to be arrested.

instruction: Is it permissible for a judge or magistrate to hear an appeal from a judgement or order they themselves have passed or made?
output: No, a judge or magistrate shall not hear an appeal from any judgement or order passed or made by himself.

instruction: Who can make regulations for the regulation and control of primary education in the district?
output: The Governor

instruction: Which section is about compelling the presence of a person?
output: Section 250 is about compelling the presence of a person.

instruction: What extent does the executive power of the Union have in relation to the State?
output: The executive power of the Union shall extend to the giving of directions to a State.

instruction: What does Section 81 specify about the procedure by Magistrate before whom such person arrested is brought?
output: Section 81 specifies the Procedure by Magistrate before whom such person arrested is brought.

instruction: What should the Governor of Nagaland ensure about the money provided by the Government of India from the Consolidated Fund of India for any specific service or purpose?
output: The Governor of Nagaland should ensure that this money is included in the demand for a grant relating to that service or purpose and not in any other demand when making his recommendation.

instruction: What is the Gujarat Act 30 of 1976, s. 2?
output: It is the act that made the amendment to section 209 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 in its application to the State of Gujarat.

instruction: What happens when a Magistrate attaches the subject of a dispute?
output: The subject of dispute remains attached until a competent Court has determined the rights of the parties thereto with regard to the person entitled to the possession thereof.

instruction: What happens with the period of detention passed due to delay in proceeding caused by the accused during the computation of the period of detention for granting bail?
output: The period of detention passed due to delay in proceeding caused by the accused is excluded when computing the period of detention for granting bail.

instruction: Which parts of the Code don't apply to the State of Nagaland and the tribal areas?
output: The provisions of this Code, other than those relating to Chapters VIII, X and XI

instruction: What happens when sureties declare themselves jointly and severally responsible for an individual's court appearance, and what do they bind themselves to do in case of default?
output: When a bond with sureties is to be executed, the additional clause is that the sureties declare themselves jointly and severally responsible for the individual's appearance before the court on the specified date or dates. In case of default, they bind themselves to forfeit a certain sum of rupees to the government.

instruction: What happens if a proportion of the fine is paid or levied before the expiration of the term of imprisonment fixed in default of payment, such that the term of imprisonment suffered in default of payment is not less than proportional to the part of the fine still unpaid?
output: The imprisonment shall terminate.

instruction: What is the amendment of section 357 of the Principal Act in Madhya Pradesh?
output: In sub-section (1), when a Court imposes a sentence of fine or a sentence of which fine forms a part, the Court may order the whole or any part of the fine recovered to be applied. This particularly applies where a person against whom an offence is committed belongs to Scheduled Castes or Scheduled Tribes as defined in clauses (24) and (25) and of Article 366 of the Constitution.

instruction: Can the Assistant Public Prosecutor appear and plead without any written authority in a court case under inquiry or trial?
output: Yes

instruction: What crime is punishable by imprisonment for 10 years and a fine?
output: An attempt to murder

instruction: What powers would an officer hold while conducting an inquiry into an offence?
output: The officer would hold all the powers he has when conducting a normal inquiry.

instruction: What is the maximum punishment, including potential fines, for a public servant who intentionally frames an incorrect document to cause harm?
output: The punishment can extend up to three years of imprisonment, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: Who is not entitled to call for or see the police diaries even if they are referred to by the Court?
output: Neither the accused nor his agents are entitled to call for or see the police diaries.

instruction: What does it mean to alter the composition of a coin?
output: Altering the composition of a coin refers to a person who scoops out part of the coin and puts anything else into the cavity.

instruction: Where can an act be tried if it is an offence by relation to another offence?
output: The act can be tried by a Court within whose local jurisdiction either act was done.

instruction: Which section of the Indian Penal Code pertains to the treatment of victims?
output: Section 357C

instruction: Who is the victim of dishonest misappropriation of property according to section 403?
output: The owner of the property misappropriated.

instruction: For how long does every Municipality continue unless sooner dissolved under any law?
output: Five years from the date appointed for its first meeting

instruction: What is the focus of section 285?
output: Section 285 focuses on to whom the commission should be issued.

instruction: Who is responsible for specifying the castes, races or tribes that shall be deemed to be Scheduled Castes in relation to a State or Union territory?
output: The President

instruction: What does it refer to when measures are taken to preserve, protect, and improve livestock, prevent animal diseases, and provide veterinary training and practice?
output: It refers to the preservation, protection and improvement of stock and prevention of animal diseases; veterinary training and practice.

instruction: What is the Andhra Pradesh Regulation 1 of 1959 also known as?
output: It is also known as the Andhra Pradesh Scheduled Areas Land Transfer Regulation, 1959.

instruction: What modern and scientific techniques are used in the examination of blood, blood stains, semen, swabs in case of sexual offences, sputum and sweat, hair samples and finger nail clippings?
output: DNA profiling and such other tests which the registered medical practitioner thinks necessary in a particular case.

instruction: Who is responsible for determining the emoluments, allowances, and privileges of the Vice-President in India?
output: Parliament

instruction: What could be the possible consequences for someone who intentionally omits to give information of an offence they are legally bound to inform about?
output: The punishment is imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What does the accused bind themselves to in Form No. 3?
output: In Form No. 3, the accused binds themselves to attend in the Court on a specified date to answer to the charge and to continue to attend until otherwise directed by the Court. In case of default, they bind themselves to forfeit a specified sum of money to the Government.

instruction: What is the offence defined in section 264?
output: Section 264 defines the fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing as an offence.

instruction: Is a person who witnessed a search required to attend the Court as a witness of the search only if they are specially summoned by it?
output: Yes, they are only required to attend if they are specially summoned by the Court.

instruction: When does the sentence commence for a person who has been sentenced to imprisonment in default of furnishing security, and then sentenced to imprisonment for an offence committed prior to the making of the order?
output: The latter sentence shall commence immediately.

instruction: What rules can the State Government make under section 5 with regards to released convicts' residence notifications and changes?
output: The State Government may make rules to carry out the provisions of this section relating to the notification of residence or change of, or absence from, residence by released convicts.

instruction: Who is allowed to examine the accused at the request of a police officer under law 53?
output: A medical practitioner.

instruction: What shall the Collector do if a warrant is issued by the court for the recovery of an amount?
output: The Collector shall realise the amount in accordance with the law relating to recovery of arrears of land revenue, as if such warrant were a certificate issued under such law.

instruction: Where are the words 'or of the substance thereof to be served by wireless message' inserted according to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands U.T. Act 6 of 1977?
output: They are inserted in subsection 1 of section 69 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1974.

instruction: What is the punishment for the act of assault or criminal force with the intention to dishonour a person, not provoked by grave circumstances?
output: Punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

instruction: What does the accused plead to before the charge is read out and explained in a Court of Session trial?
output: The accused pleads that he has complied with the conditions on which the tender of pardon was made.

instruction: What is the punishment for the fifth offense?
output: Imprisonment for 2 years, or fine of 1,000 rupees, or both.

instruction: Where are the statements and confessions, if any, recorded?
output: Under section 161 or section 164.

instruction: What does the term 'population' refer to in this context?
output: The population as ascertained at the last preceding census of which the relevant figures have been published

instruction: What was substituted for section 4 by Act 4 of 1898, s. 2?
output: The amendment done

instruction: What does the High Court do if it decides all the applications for revision should be disposed of by itself?
output: The High Court directs that the applications for revision pending before the Sessions Judge be transferred to itself.

instruction: In what language should every such record and judgment be written?
output: Every such record and judgment shall be written in the language of the Court.

instruction: What is the penalty for dishonestly making a false claim in court?
output: The person can be punished with imprisonment of up to two years, and can also be liable to a fine.

instruction: Which form number is used for a warrant of attachment in the case of a dispute as to the possession of land, etc.?
output: FORM NO. 26

instruction: Who should examine an arrested person soon after the arrest is made if a medical officer is not available?
output: A registered medical practitioner

instruction: What does the number 326 refer to in terms of causing harm?
output: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt

instruction: Can a party appear before a magistrate, Court or Officer in person if they are not in custody?
output: Yes, any such party may appear before such magistrate, Court or Officer in person if they are not in custody.

instruction: What responsibilities do Regional Councils or District Councils have in regulating village councils and courts, according to paragraph 4?
output: They have the power to make rules regulating the constitution of village councils and courts, the procedure to be followed by village councils or courts, the enforcement of decisions and orders of such councils and courts, and all other ancillary matters for the carrying out of the provisions.

instruction: What does the order requiring the State Government of Andhra Pradesh to organise any class or classes of posts in a civil service or any class or classes of civil posts under the State into different local cadres for different parts of the State, and specifying the local area for direct recruitment to posts in any local cadre under the State Government, for direct recruitment to posts in any cadre under any local authority within the State, and for the purposes of admission to any University within the State or to any other educational institution which is subject to the control of the State Government, made under clause (1)?
output: This order can be made under clause (1).

instruction: Who can judge the case of theft after preparation for causing harm?
output: Magistrate of the first class.

instruction: Which section discusses being hired to take part in an unlawful assembly or riot; or to go armed?
output: Section 158

instruction: Which section of the law outlines the crime of 'Hurt'?
output: Section 319

instruction: Is it necessary for the abettor to commit the act in the offence of abetment by conspiracy?
output: No, it is not necessary to the commission of the offence of abetment by conspiracy that the abettor should commit the act.

instruction: What does the administrative expenses of a High Court include?
output: The administrative expenses of a High Court include all salaries, allowances and pensions payable to or in respect of the officers and servants of the Court.

instruction: What does 'Arms' refer to in the context of section 153AA?
output: 'Arms' refers to articles of any description designed or adapted as weapons for offence or defence, including firearms, sharp edged weapons, lathis, dandas and sticks.

instruction: What is the principal required to do in Form No. 52?
output: The principal is required to pay the said penalty of rupees or to show cause before the court why payment of the same should not be enforced against them.

instruction: What is the procedure for a police officer in charge of an investigation if they cannot complete it within 24 hours of an arrest?
output: The officer in charge of the police station or the police officer making the investigation, if he is not below the rank of sub-inspector, shall forthwith transmit to the nearest Judicial Magistrate a copy of the entries in the diary relating to the case, and shall at the same time forward the accused to such Magistrate.

instruction: What happens if an Ordinance makes a provision that Parliament would not be competent to enact?
output: If an Ordinance under this article makes any provision which Parliament would not under this Constitution be competent to enact, it shall be void.

instruction: Does the Parliament or the Legislature of a State have the power to make a law that gives preference to one State over another, or make any discrimination between one State and another, in terms of trade and commerce?
output: No, neither Parliament nor the Legislature of a State has the power to make any law that gives preference to one State over another, or make any discrimination between one State and another, in terms of trade and commerce.

instruction: What happens if the President directs the Governor to return the law to the North Cachar Hills Autonomous Council or the Karbi Anglong Autonomous Council?
output: The said Council shall consider the law accordingly within a period of six months from the date of receipt of such message and, if the law is again passed by the said Council with or without amendment it shall be presented again to the President for his consideration.

instruction: What can an order made under clause (3) of The Constitution of India authorize the Administrative Tribunal to do?
output: The order can authorise the Administrative Tribunal to receive representations for the redress of grievances relating to any matter within its jurisdiction as the President may specify in the order and to make such orders thereon as the Administrative Tribunal deems fit.

instruction: Who is responsible for instituting a complaint against the President, Vice President, Governor of a State, or a Minister regarding their conduct in public functions?
output: The Public Prosecutor.

instruction: Who is liable for punishment if A instigates a child under seven, B, to commit murder?
output: A is liable to be punished in the same manner as if B had been capable by law of committing an offence.

instruction: What can be done when an offence is committed during a journey or voyage?
output: When an offence is committed during a journey or voyage, it may be inquired into or tried by a Court through or into whose local jurisdiction that person or thing passed in the course of that journey or voyage.

instruction: What articles of the Constitution apply to a specific State and what modifications can be made?
output: The articles of the Constitution that apply to a specific State are article 1 and the article in question. The other provisions of the Constitution may also apply, subject to exceptions and modifications that the President may specify by order.

instruction: What is the provision regarding the conduct of trials under sections 376AB, 376B, 376C, 376D, 376DA, 376DB, and 376E of the Indian Penal Code?
output: The trials shall be conducted in camera. However, the presiding Judge may, if he thinks fit, or on an application made by either of the parties, allow any particular person to have access to, or be or remain in, the room or building used by the Court.

instruction: What is Bihar Act XX of 1954?
output: The Bihar Land Reforms (Amendment) Act, 1953

instruction: What is included in the expression 'law in force' in this article?
output: The expression 'law in force' in this article shall include a law passed or made by a Legislature or other competent authority in the territory of India before the commencement of this Constitution.

instruction: What should happen before making an order imposing a fine under sub-section (1)?
output: The person affected shall be given a reasonable opportunity of being heard.

instruction: What should a police officer have visible and clear for easy identification when making an arrest?
output: Every police officer while making an arrest should have an accurate, visible and clear identification of his name.

instruction: Which section's provisions are applicable when the accused is called upon to enter upon his defence and produce his evidence according to section 247?
output: The provisions of section 243 apply.

instruction: What is murder in dacoity?
output: The text does not provide a specific definition of murder in dacoity.

instruction: What does 'Offence' denote according to this Code?
output: 'Offence' denotes a thing made punishable by this Code, or under any special or local law as hereinafter defined.

instruction: When is a person not deprived of the right of private defence against an act done by a public servant?
output: A person is not deprived of the right of private defence against an act done by a public servant, unless he knows or has reason to believe, that the person doing the act is a public servant.

instruction: Who can the President nominate to the House of the People if he believes a certain community is not adequately represented?
output: The President may nominate not more than two members of the Anglo-Indian community

instruction: Does the text provide a complete answer to whether A can be charged again after being convicted of theft of property from the person of B by a Magistrate of the second class?
output: No, the text does not provide a complete answer to this question.

instruction: Who is Form No. 16 addressed to?
output: The Officer in charge of the Jail

instruction: How are the seats reserved for women in Panchayats allotted?
output: By rotation to different constituencies in a Panchayat

instruction: What is the nature and bail status of offense 296?
output: Cognizable, Bailable

instruction: What will the Magistrate do if the offence is triable exclusively by the Court of Session?
output: If the offence is triable exclusively by the Court of Session, the Magistrate shall commit the case to the Court of Session after complying with the provisions of section 207 or section 208, as the case may be.

instruction: Who aids and advises the Governor in the exercise of his functions, unless required to exercise his functions in his discretion by the Constitution?
output: The Council of Ministers, with the Chief Minister at the head, aids and advises the Governor in the exercise of his functions.

instruction: What is the official term for the process of a lunatic being given into the care of a relative or friend?
output: 339. Delivery of lunatic to care of relative or friend.

instruction: Who can issue a summons to witnesses to attend or produce documents on the application of the prosecution?
output: The Magistrate can do this.

instruction: To what extent can the right of private defence be exercised?
output: The right of private defence in no case extends to the inflicting of more harm than it is necessary to inflict for the purpose of defence.

instruction: Who can refer a cause or matter for decision or report?
output: Every arbitrator or other person to whom any cause or matter has been referred by any Court of Justice, or by any other competent public authority.

instruction: What provisions can a State Legislature make to ensure member participation in co-operative society management?
output: A State Legislature can ensure member participation in co-operative society management by stipulating a minimum requirement for meeting attendance and service utilization.

instruction: What happens with the plea of the accused?
output: The plea of the accused and his examination (if any) are recorded.

instruction: What happens when a law is reserved for the consideration of the President?
output: The President shall declare either that he assents to the said law or that he withholds assent.

instruction: Which section focuses on the power to dispense with personal attendance?
output: Section 115

instruction: Where can the Court of Special Judicial Magistrate hold its sitting?
output: At any place within the local area for which it is established

instruction: Which court handles cases of possession of instrument or material for the purpose of counterfeiting coin?
output: Court of Session.

instruction: What power does the House of the People have in relation to the financial year?
